programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: Crabbe tracks down a peeping Tom who has taken to stealing underwear, all the while growing more concerned about the direction his enquiries are taking. Culinary crime drama, starring Richard Griffiths, Maggie Steed, Malcolm Sinclair and Edward Atterton

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: As a full-scale search is launched for PC Hollis, the kidnapped copper desperately tries to overcome his fear and establish some sort of rapport with his captors - but his fate ultimately rests in the hands of Des Taviner as he takes the stand to give evidence at Simpson's trial. Gilmore is initially dismayed to learn about Ashton's date with PC Kerry Young but is soon reassured that there's nothing amiss and begins to wonder if he's found the man of his dreams

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: When a family secret is exposed, the dispute causes a young patient to delay vital surgery, but fearing the consequences of such a decision a concerned Ange must find a way to make her reconsider. Ric campaigns for change, but who will be caught up in his personal crusade? And it remains to be seen whether Nicky has the strength to fight for what she wants

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: The day of Blake's trial arrives, and while he pleads guilty to GBH, his victim Miles collapses at home. When he is rushed into the ED, Elle finds herself face-to-face with the boy her son attacked, and must determine whether his deteriorating condition is due to Blake's actions. Meanwhile, Bea's one-night stand causes her to find out Rash's big secret

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Ambitious new DS Samantha Nixon arrives at Sun Hill and soon impresses everyone with her profiling skills. Danny Glaze casts a shadow over Des Taviner's future by making it clear that he won't lie under oath, while Reg Hollis co-operates with the kidnapping inquiry but seems oddly vague on some points. Lisa Maxwell and Paul Usher star

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: A furious Tom risks his life when proving his point to Mark

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Kat and Anthony confront each other, with dire consequences

programme.desc: Maritime drama with the Howard family, starring Maurice Colbourne and Jan Harvey

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: Crabbe and PC Guthrie go back to school to investigate the possession of Ecstasy tablets and the beating of a police chief's son, and it is not long before Freddy Fisher finds himself under close scrutiny. Richard Griffiths stars

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Jack tries to help his ex-fiancee Karen, who is an acute schizophrenic, and fails to correctly diagnose Kim's rare infection. Medical drama, starring Amanda Burton and Kevin Whately

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean falls out with Lionel, but the tense atmosphere between them does not prevent a visit from her sister-in-law Penny and husband Stephen. Bob Larbey's comedy about late-blossoming love, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Hyacinth visits a stately home, where she naturally tries her hardest to meet the lord of the manor - only to be thwarted by the untimely arrival of Onslow and Daisy. Suburban comedy, starring Patricia Routledge, Clive Swift and Geoffrey Hughes

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Wesley discovers an old racing car, which Compo, Clegg and Foggy offer to help him transport back to his shed, not reckoning on its condition. Long-running rural comedy, starring Bill Owen, Peter Sallis and Brian Wilde, with Gordon Wharmby

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Wally is called upon to settle an argument between Compo and Foggy - the exact size of Nora Batty's feet. Bill Owen, Kathy Staff and Joe Gladwin star

programme.title: The Inspector Lynley Mysteries
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The Lynleys are looking forward to becoming parents, but Helen succumbs to temptation and dabbles in her husband's latest case. However, her past involvement with the victim unwittingly puts her in the firing line, with devastating consequences for everyone. Jemma Redgrave and Barbara Flynn guest star, with Nathaniel Parker, Sharon Small and Lesley Vickerage

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The detectives investigate the kidnapping of two boys in 1979, which they believe could be linked to a recent spate of disappearances. The youngsters involved in the earlier case escaped - though their abductor was never found. Fearing they may be on the trail of a serial killer, the detectives also uncover a link with another unsolved case - the assault on a champion fisherman

programme.title: Clocking Off
programme.desc: Army veteran Mark starts work at the factory to a mixed reception. The lads do not pay him much attention but he manages to secure a date with machinist Hannah before turning his attention to Nick's wife Kim. James Murray and Emma Cunniffe star

programme.title: Bad Girls
programme.desc: Fenner is furious when Tina refuses to co-operate any further, while Karen decides she finally has the evidence she needs to get rid of him for good. Di is quick to let him know what's going on, and he soon spies an opportunity to turn the tables. A new prison officer causes a stir when she arrives on G-Wing, Bev and Phyl cause chaos at a restaurant and Al is forced to face her traumatic childhood as she prepares to go to court

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Part one of two. An American acquaintance of Lovejoy's is sold some fake antiques, so he sets out to exact revenge on the dealer responsible - and make a little money into the bargain. Linda Gray and Brian Blessed guest star, with Ian McShane

programme.title: Passport to Freedom
programme.desc: As the Nazis begin sending Jews to prison, João must persuade Aracy that he's serious about joining her rescue efforts

Meanwhile, Gem proves her worth on her first day as an ED porter, and when no less than nine patients from a single retirement home are admitted with chest pains, the staff try to find out whether they have anything in common other than their address

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Love-struck Gilmore is desperate to speak to Ashton but the object of his affections is more taken with Young's romantic overtures. Guest starring Roger Lloyd Pack

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: A familiar face returns - but has being away changed her? Anthony and Kat face the prospect of making some painful decisions, while Robbie tries to do the right thing

programme.desc: Disaster strikes during a powerboat display, and Ken wants to get back together with Jan

programme.desc: As the crucial final match approaches, Fisher asks Crabbe to keep an eye on the police football ground and look after an ex-professional player with a murky past - but there may be more to his new protege than meets the eye. Richard Griffiths stars

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: After secretly meeting her ex-lover, Beth comes across an accident on the moors which takes a life-threatening turn - but Jack manages to give her life a new direction. Amanda Burton stars

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Lionel is concerned that he has no pension plans, so the ever-resourceful Alistair comes up with an ingenious idea - to sell the country house. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Hyacinth feels harassed by a combination of working at a charity shop, trying to impress Councillor Nugent and worrying about Rose's love life. To cap it all, Daisy informs her that a strange woman in Daddy's bedroom claims to be his fiancee. Starring Patricia Routledge

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: The discovery of an abandoned mattress leads Foggy to embark on an town-wide clean-up campaign. Brian Glover guest stars in the rural comedy, with Brian Wilde, Peter Sallis and Bill Owen

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: In his latest attempt to impress Nora Batty, Compo borrows Crusher Milburn's bright red motorcycle and dons racing leathers to become a daredevil biker. Comedy, starring Bill Owen, with Kathy Staff

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: A woman is released from prison after a 35-year campaign to clear her of murder - which is bad news for Dalziel, who was the investigating officer responsible for her conviction all those years ago. With his reputation at stake, the bluff copper decides to reinvestigate - and soon uncovers a link with the secret services. Feature-length drama, with guest appearances by Shirley Anne Field, Leslie Phillips and Tom Bell alongside Warren Clarke and Colin Buchanan

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: A Home Office pathologist joins the team to help discover the identity of a dead girl found in woodland in 1987. The detectives trace her origins back to the Highlands of Scotland, uncovering evidence of syphilis and a possible connection with local aristocrat Lady Deeley. Meanwhile, Lane confronts his fears by revisiting the crime scene. Detective drama, guest starring Timothy West and Jane Asher

programme.title: Clocking Off
programme.desc: Julie's brother comes home for their parents' 40th wedding anniversary celebrations and invites her to work with him in Hong Kong. She decides to accept and escape her boring life when there appears to be nothing to keep her in England, especially since none of her friends do a good job of persuading her to stay. Only new machinist Vicky has a hope of changing her mind

programme.title: Bad Girls
programme.desc: Di takes over as governor, and promptly tells Fenner he has nothing to worry about as long as she is in charge. The scheming officer makes a bee-line for Yvonne to gloat, prompting her determined to come up with a plan to finally destroy him. A new inmate causes a stir and it soon becomes clear she has got something to hide, and Christopher Biggins returns with a surprise and some thrilling news for an overwhelmed Buki

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Part two of two. Lovejoy sets out to exact revenge on the dealer responsible for deceiving his American acquaintance - and make a little money for himself into the bargain. Linda Gray and Brian Blessed guest star, with Ian McShane

programme.title: Passport to Freedom
programme.desc: As Thomas Zumkle launches an investigation of corrupt officials in Hamburg, he looks to link João to the illegal sale of Brazilian visas

programme.desc: Foggy, Compo and Clegg spot Digby chasing his donkey around his paddock. Foggy claims that a little planning will see the beast caught, and volunteers the trio to complete the task. Brian Wilde, Peter Sallis and Bill Owen star

programme.title: Strike
programme.desc: Conclusion of the two-part adaptation of JK Rowling's detective novel. Strike and Robin become suspicious of Fancourt after he makes a revealing mistake during a TV interview, while an encounter at a party leads to further suspicious revelations. The authorship of the fatal novel comes under question, and a literary analyst is called in to examine the test. Matthew is less than happy to discover that Strike and Robin are working together again, while Leonora discovers a mysterious purchase was made on the family credit card

programme.desc: A car in which a teacher was murdered five years earlier is returned to its owner - the victim's husband. Detective drama, starring Amanda Redman, James Bolam, Dennis Waterman and Alun Armstrong

Denise is left conflicted when she drunkenly makes a move on Ravi and he turns her down. The ladies of Walford settle in for a lock-in but it becomes apparent that everything can change in a flash

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: PG Tips and Lipton's are world-famous tea brands and an undercover investigation reveals that women working on plantations producing them are being pressured to have sex with their bosses in return for work. The report focuses on plantations that have been owned for years by two British companies - Unilever and James Finlay and Company - who between them have produced half the tea drunk in the UK. Reporter Tom Odula has spoken to dozens of women who say they have been sexually assaulted or harassed, while undercover footage reveals how one young woman was targeted for sex at a job interview

programme.title: Scarlett's Driving School
programme.desc: Fifty-six-year-old Linda is desperate to get a driving licence so she can help look after her grandchildren, but as an 'older learner' who is hard of hearing she has failed her test six times. Teaching Linda is her 53-year-old sister Debbie, but after three years in the car together, both of them are at the end of their tethers. Can five days at Scarlett's Driving School help create some calm in the car, and more importantly give Linda the parking and navigation skills she needs to pass at her seventh attempt?

programme.title: Better
programme.desc: Lou struggles to keep up appearances with Col, inviting further suspicion. Desperate to get away from him and clear her conscience, she seeks help from an unexpected source. Bulgey and Artem pay Jade Wilkes a visit to determine whether she revealed the whereabouts of Noel's safehouse to anyone. Drama, starring Leila Farzad

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Go Hard or Go Home
programme.desc: Bobsleigher Adele Nicoll, ex-footballer Ashley Cain, former rugby player Heather Fisher, MMA star Leah McCourt, Muay Thai fighter Nesrine Dally, Olympic gymnast Nile Wilson and fitness trainers Tyrone Brennand and Waz Ashayer set out to change eight contestants' lives - and help them push themselves to their absolute limit. Presented by Jordan North and Paul Olima

programme.title: Go Hard or Go Home
programme.desc: After their individual training sessions, the trainees take on their first head-to-head challenge - a seemingly simply battle to be the first to grab a mallet, get past their opponent and bang a gong. Back at the hacienda, the winners are treated to a slap-up meal served by the losers, although not everyone sees the funny side

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Judi Dench talks about her heart-warming film Allelujah, while Paul Rudd and Michael Douglas - stars of Marvel's Ant-Man and the Wasp: Quantumania - also pop in for a chat. Greatest Showman Hugh Jackman talks about his role in The Son, a powerful drama about fatherhood, Michael B Jordan promotes boxing sequel Creed III, while Eugene Levy discusses his new TV series The Reluctant Traveller. Plus, there's music from P!nk, who performs her new single Trustfall

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Guest host Jack Dee and panellists Nabil Abdulrashid and Hannah Fry join team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop as they delve into the news. From April 2022

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Gethin Jones and Sam Quek present the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Caught Red Handed
programme.desc: A woman suspects a workman in her garden is guilty of a crime and a council witness the worst fly-tipper they've ever seen. Plus a burglar has a painful encounter with a tree

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: A woman pursuing an £800,000 claim after a factory accident is caught out on camera and two men trying to cash in on a car crash are exposed as liars. An inmate in a high security prison ends up in hot water after falling on a wet floor and a driver who ran up £134,000 in hire car charges after claiming his vehicle isn't roadworthy gets caught in a lie. A footballer scores an own goal when his posts on social media ruin his claim for whiplash

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts and the team explore a property with an impressive view on the east coast of Scotland, several properties in Norwich and a trio of terraces in Sheffield

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles hosts the show from Norfolk's biggest Antique Centre in King's Lynn. Experts Caroline Hawley and Mark Stacey assist the Reds and the Blues as they do battle

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Zara deals with the aftermath of the explosion, while Daniel tries to get everyone to speak to a counsellor - with differing results. Rob and Jimmi help a police officer who was part of the rescue team in the explosion, but all is not what it seems

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Two farming couples brave the elements at Lewes Farmers' Market, East Sussex, in the hope that customers will turn up to buy their slow-grown lamb and quality beef

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton hops between Herefordshire and neighbouring counties to help a buyer from Guernsey find a perfect property in the countryside on a budget of £500,000

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Catherine and David head to Sussex and find themselves feeling nostalgic. David has a flashback to his school cricket team giving an unwise demonstration in a room full of china and Catherine has a hankering for items with an aeronautical theme

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Alan, Lin, Sharon and Nicola compete for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Lauren Laverne and Jermaine Jenas present another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Kim is seeking a Walford man to take part in her livestream and Ravi tries to patch things up with Denise. Sharon asks Phil for business advice and realises she's still in love with Keanu. Meanwhile, Karen worries about Kat when she asks to reduce her hours at the launderette

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles meets Kettering mum of four Lindsey, who married her ex-Royal Engineer husband Shaun in December 2019, after which they began to extend their Kettering home. But a few months later Shaun was struck down with cancer, and died in November 2021, leaving Lindsey and her children with an unfinished home. But help is on hand as the DIY SOS team, along with hundreds of local trades and several of Shaun's old army buddies, step in to finish the job

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Panorama follows the lives of five Ukrainians during the war with Russia over the last year including a paramedic on the frontline, a wedding-turned-war photographer, a TV presenter who rescues civilians under fire, a 19 year-old army volunteer and a young couple who's home town has now been occupied by Russian forces. This personal and powerful documentary marks the first anniversary of the war

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Bad Education
programme.desc: Stephen wants to turn the school play into a showcase for his talents to impress an agent, but Hoburn has more sinister plans to use it as a way of closing the school down

programme.title: Go Hard or Go Home
programme.desc: One trainee leaves the island at the first Warrior Summit after the Earth Element Challenge in which the trainees have to build and climb a 13 metre bamboo ladder to escape one of the island's deepest caves. The two who take the longest to escape are evaluated and one is voted out

programme.title: The Apprentice
programme.desc: The remaining candidates are tasked to design a new lunchbox aimed at six-to-eight-year-olds, along with an app to encourage healthy eating. For one team, a clear vision helps them take a bite out of the market, though poor decisions and a lack of vision on the other side leads to dreary designs. In the boardroom there's no such thing as a free lunch, as one candidate is dismissed at the hands of Lord Sugar

programme.title: Caught Red Handed
programme.desc: A former magistrate finds burglars brazenly carrying a safe out of her home and a young cashier teams up with his aunt to rugby tackle an armed robber

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: A family get caught in a £20,000 food poisoning scam and investigators catch a taxi driver out after discovering his history involving 20 previous accidents. An injured inmate who wanted £8,000 after taking a tumble in his cell has his claim stopped in its tracks and two men who invented injuries to claim on a car crash are exposed and ordered to pay thousands. A builder claiming £12,000 after tripping at work slips up when he claims the fall ruined his holiday

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell examine the potential of properties in Plymouth, Wallasey in Merseyside and Tufnell Park in north London. All are sold at online auctions by developers hoping to make a profit on their investment buys

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Host Anita Manning visits the Elsecar Heritage Centre in South Yorkshire, where Tim Weeks and Caroline Hawley help two teams scour an antiques fair and pick up bargains to sell for profit at auction. Anita also pays a visit to one of Europe's largest houses

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Rob struggles to adjust to living with Scarlett, Emma challenges Luca to cook a meal and Bear is caught between two old friends in the middle of a marriage breakdown

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Sheepdog trialists Ross and James are both joined by their sons as they compete at the Macclesfield Sheepdog Trials, only to face tough competition, bad weather and difficult sheep

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: A couple with two young sons and not enough room in their current home enlist Sonali Shah to help them find a bigger place in the Somerset countryside on a budget of £450,000. Away from the house hunting, Sonali checks out a local project to tackle climate change by planting half a million trees over the next five years

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Catherine and David visit the Isle of Wight. While David finds some Dutch dishes, a Chinese canister and a South Indian lamp, Catherine is pleased with a Scottish Wemyss ware jar

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Suki accuses Karen of stealing and Linda is torn on her decision of selling Mick's half of The Vic. Denise agrees to meet Ravi at a hotel and Sharon and Keanu agree to go on a date

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the team of experts bring four treasured family heirlooms back to life. The first arrival of the day is widow Eve Robinson from Kings Lynn, Norfolk, who hopes that goldsmith Richard Talman can mend her diamond wedding ring. Next, Wizard Geoff turns his attention to a vintage penny arcade game which was salvaged from a bonfire over 40 years ago. Elsewhere, the experts set to work repairing a shop mannequin and a pair of lumberjack's tree spurs

programme.title: Sort Your Life Out with Stacey Solomon
programme.desc: Stacey Solomon coaches the Smith family through a mammoth declutter as their possessions are laid out in a warehouse as though it were an art installation they discover 207 loose nappies, 145 Punjabi suits and 24 old toothbrushes amongst other things. Things get emotional as Raaj lets go of some of her late sister's belongings whom she lost to Covid two years ago. Carpenter Rob works hard to make their three bedroom hose fit six people and Dilly creates a brand-new larder while reorganising the kitchen

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: The Traitors US
programme.desc: Alliances are broken, and trust is questioned on the penultimate day in the castle. The players have the opportunity to add to the prize pot of $168,800

programme.title: The Traitors US
programme.desc: It's the final day and all that stands between the players and the prize money is the ultimate mission, the final banishing and The Fire of Truth

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedians Lucy Beaumont and Desiree Burch, Strictly judge Anton Du Beke and actor Ralf Little join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the offbeat panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory, through rounds such as Home Truths and Quick-fire Lies

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Wiltshire is the final bargain hunting location, where Margie Cooper hunts down a real mixed bag of offerings, from a large Edwardian shoe sign to an early 20th-century African thumb piano, while Ochuko Ojiri's heart is captured by a set of 1930s hat moulds. Who will come out on top at auction?

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Family and friends Vijai, Sheetal, Jyoti and Rajen compete for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: Winterwatch
programme.desc: Chris Packham and Michaela Strachan reveal some ingenious beetle adaptations in the macro studio at Wild Ken Hill in Norfolk. Megan McCubbin immerses herself in one of our most iconic winter spectacles as she goes swimming with starlings. In Edinburgh, Gillian Burke and Iolo Williams have moved from the cemetery to the river, to explore the city's waterways

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Murder, Mystery and My Family: Case Closed?
programme.desc: Jeremy Dein and Sasha Wass revisit an infamous 1889 murder case, where a young American woman was charged with poisoning her husband in Liverpool

programme.title: Wonders of the Monsoon
programme.desc: Colin Salmon narrates a documentary exploring how the lives of humans and animals across a vast area of the planet are affected by the transforming power of the monsoon rains. The end of the dry season in northern Australia sees 300,000 flying foxes gathering to drink while running a gauntlet of freshwater crocodiles, while in Sumatra a female orang-utan guides her youngster to where she knows a fig tree fruits at this time of year. At the Delhi stock exchange, the price of rice escalates every day the rains fail to materialise and priests submerge themselves in water and beseech Varuna, god of water, to come

programme.title: Coast and Country Auctions
programme.desc: A visit to the Bala Autumn Sale in Snowdonia, north Wales, where veteran seller Emrys Jones is hoping to get well over £2,000 for each of his dogs - Jim and Ross - at auction

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents as the team values antiques at the Museum of Science and Industry in Manchester. Anita Manning and Michael Baggott examine items including a French book of butterflies and an Inuit carving. Plus, a look at a rare and beautiful art book that is contested at auction

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Ronni Ancona, Nathan Caton, Colin Murray and Sally Phillips go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick visits an organic deer farm near Bodmin Moor ran by Pip and Matt Smith, before returning to the kitchen in Padstow to make a simple venison Wellington. Later, he spends an afternoon on Porthgwarra beach with the artist Hannah Woodman, whose work is inspired by the sea-worn landscape of West Cornwall, before defining the Cornish sense of humour over a pint with comedian Jonny Cowling

programme.title: A Special School
programme.desc: Return of the documentary following life at Ysgol y Der in Penarth, the Vale of Glamorgan, which is Britain's biggest special school. It's the first day back after the summer holidays and headteacher Chris Britten recalls the strain of staying open during the pandemic, while some of the young pupils go on the first field trip of the year. Back at school, staff have to act quickly to try to control the situation when a sixth-former who finds it hard to control his emotions and temper has an outburst and escapes from class. Narrated by Iwan Rheon

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: Clive Myrie invites four more contestants to brave the black chair, who answer questions on the specialist subjects of the plays of Tennessee Williams, US First Ladies from 1945 to the present day, NBA MVP award winners from 2000 onwards, and Mithridates the Great, before they are tested on their general knowledge

programme.title: Only Connect
programme.desc: Victoria Coren Mitchell hosts as the Strigiformes take on the Morporkians in first of the semi-finals as the two teams compete to guess the connections between things that seem utterly random at first glance, with one set of clues asking what links On Top of Spaghetti, Pinocchio's time inside Monstro, Adelaide's Lament, and the cocaine scene in the film Annie Hall

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: The second round of the student quiz concludes, with two teams of four pitting their wits against one another as they attempt to secure the last place in the quarter-finals. Jeremy Paxman asks the questions

programme.title: Parole
programme.desc: An inside look at the high-stakes world of parole hearings, where the futures of prisoners hang in the balance, as well of that of the victims and/or their families. The first episode follows 54-year-old Colin, who committed murder following a pub fight 25 years ago, as he hopes for a chance to be released from prison. Later, serial fraudster David, who spent four decades swindling thousands of pounds out of the women he dated, tries to convince the parole board he is a changed man

programme.title: Detectorists
programme.desc: The return of Mackenzie Crook's award-winning comedy in which he and Toby Jones star as metal detector enthusiasts in search of their hearts' desire. Andy is considering internet dating. Not for him, but for Lance, who is still not over the departure of his ex-wife. Meanwhile, a mysterious stranger arrives to tempt the metal detecting club - in more ways than one. Real-life mother and daughter Diana Rigg and Rachael Stirling co-star, with Gerard Horan and Sophie Thompson

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories. With Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Suburbicon (2017)
programme.desc: In the summer of 1959, a mild-mannered family man must face his demons after a home invasion shakes his quaint neighbourhood, as he has to navigate the town's dark underbelly of betrayal, deceit, and violence. Black comedy directed by George Clooney, starring Matt Damon, Julianne Moore and Oscar Isaac

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Joe Crowley and Steve Brown head to the North Yorkshire coast and the beautiful village of Staithes to find out how the traditional fishing community is adapting for the future. Where once there was a fishing fleet of 80, now there is just one fishermen left. Joe also goes out to sea to discover how one skipper has swapped nets for wildlife tourism, while Steve takes a look at Staithes' art heritage and tastes some locally-smoked goodies. Adam Henson finds out about the challenges facing a sheep dairy and Charlotte Smith investigates the latest developments behind one of Britain's biggest ecological marine disasters

programme.title: Dragons' Den
programme.desc: Entrepreneurs Peter Jones, Deborah Meaden, Touker Suleyman, Sara Davies and Steven Bartlett preside over more business opportunities, including a clothes-swapping service funded by subscriptions and a hands-free wheelchair made mobile by its user shifting their body weight. Presented by Evan Davis

programme.title: Surgeons: At the Edge of Life
programme.desc: A 17-year-old who developed scoliosis in adolescence has surgery to correct his extremely curved spine. But the procedure has its risks as the spinal cord is at the centre of the vertebrae where the surgeons must operate. The Addenbrooke's team also welcome a 75 -year-old woman who is having an operation to help with her bladder control

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: David Harper and Catherine Southon kick off a week of treasure hunting in Kent, where Catherine fancies her chances with a menagerie of mechanical animals, while David's strategy is to try his luck with some very unfashionable items - as well as a hammer that would put any auctioneer's gavel to shame

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Work colleagues Hannah, Claire, Katy and Sally compete for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers Go Local
programme.desc: Dave Myers and Si King are in the Norfolk village of East Barsham, hunting for local produce for creative country pub chef Jake, to help him keep the menu fresh for his 40-seat restaurant. Heading off, they find Norfolk geese at a local farm, a company that makes its own version of versatile vegetarian ingredient Tofu and a family-owned plum orchard. But will Jake be impressed by the Bikers' suggestions?

programme.title: The Super League Show
programme.desc: Tanya Arnold presents action from the opening round of fixtures, including Warrington Wolves v Leeds Rhinos. Plus, the World Club Challenge between Penrith Panthers and St Helens

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize. Presented by Jeremy Vine

programme.title: A to Z of TV Gardening
programme.desc: Carol Kirkwood looks at themes beginning with the letter B, as part of her alphabetical journey through the world of horticulture. Along the way, she gets inspiration and advice from some of the BBC's most popular gardening presenters

programme.title: Murder, Mystery and My Family: Case Closed?
programme.desc: Criminal barristers Sasha Wass and Jeremy Dein examine the 1935 morphine poisoning of a care home resident Ada Baguley in Nottingham. Initially Ada was thought to have died from natural causes, but a post-mortem revealed her body to contain lethal doses of morphine. Dorothea Waddingham, the owner of the nursing home and primary care giver of Ada, was later convicted of murder

programme.title: Wonders of the Monsoon
programme.desc: The effect of the rainy season on wildlife in Asia, with floods forcing animals to flee from Kaziranga National Park in north-east India in search of the safety of the hills. In Cambodia, the Mekong river swells so much that water is forced back up one of its tributaries to fill the vast Tonle Sap lake - one of the most productive freshwater fisheries on Earth. Fresh grass draws nomads and their vast herds of livestock back to their homelands, but they are stalked by hungry wolves and hyenas, which move in at night for the kill. Colin Salmon narrates

programme.title: Coast and Country Auctions
programme.desc: A visit to Spalding Plant and Vegetable Auction in Lincolnshire, where as many as 1,000 bags and boxes of vegetables and up to 16,000 plants, shrubs and trees can be sold in a day

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin, Will Axon and Philip Serrell visit Ickworth House, a Georgian mansion in Suffolk built for the Earls of Bristol, where the team picks out a selection of interesting items to be sold at auction. Will casts an appreciative eye over a piece of Martinware, but a miniature long case clock bought at the car boot for £1 could prove to be the star find. Plus, Paul heads to the Suffolk coast to explore a fantasy holiday village built in the early 20th century

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Ronni Ancona, Nathan Caton, Colin Murray and Sally Phillips go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick boards the King Harry Ferry to enjoy a crossing voted one of the most scenic in the world, rustles up a vegetarian tart and investigates the Cornish influence on Oscar-Winning composer Malcolm Arnold with Radio 3 presenter Petroc Trewlawny

programme.title: Saving Lives at Sea
programme.desc: In Porthcawl, the volunteers of the RNLI race to save a surfer at the mercy of Storm Brendan. Meanwhile, in Selsey, a family's day out for a spot of paddleboarding goes badly awry when the father becomes separated from his young children, leaving them stranded on a rapidly dwindling sandbank

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs from the North West serve up their canapes, starters and fish dishes on an animation and illustration theme. They include a Womble burrow full to bursting with roasted fungi from Stockport, mushroom broth, mushroom cookie and sunflower seed hummus, and a tomato ponzu-dressed romaine lettuce with broad beans prepared three ways, inspired by Dennis the Menace. There's also a black and white dish inspired by Aardman's penguin villain Feathers McGraw, made up of a Brazilian kibe savoury bulgur wheatcake layered with miso and tarragon oyster mushrooms, and a dish of broccoli, sea herbs and sea foam inspired by Frank Cottrell Boyce's The Astounding Broccoli Boy

programme.title: Inside Our Autistic Minds
programme.desc: The second of two documentaries in which Chris Packham helps people on the autism spectrum create short films that reveal what is really going on inside their minds. He meets Anton, a teaching assistant and trance DJ with a deep love of Middlesbrough FC, and Ethan, a 19-year-old student and aspiring rapper from Essex. He helps them make films to reveal to their friends and classmates how they feel about change and hypersensitivity to noise respectively

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Rosie Jones, Henning Wehn and Ahir Shah join regular Alan Davies on the comedy panel quiz, with Sandi Toksvig asking questions on the theme of of 'Tea Time', with points being awarded for the answers the host finds most interesting

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events with Faisal Islam

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Parole
programme.desc: An inside look at the high-stakes world of parole hearings, where the futures of prisoners hang in the balance, as well of that of the victims and/or their families. The first episode follows 54-year-old Colin, who committed murder following a pub fight 25 years ago, as he hopes for a chance to be released from prison. Later, serial fraudster David, who spent four decades swindling thousands of pounds out of the women he dated, tries to convince the parole board he is a changed man

programme.title: Journey's End (2017)
programme.desc: France, March 1918. Raleigh, a naive and idealistic young officer, arrives at the Western Front and asks to be posted to the company of his old school friend Captain Stanhope. He joins a trench full of fear, as the men await their grim fate while trying to cope with the daily pressures of the war. Adaptation of the play by RC Sherriff, starring Sam Claflin, Paul Bettany, Asa Butterfield, Toby Jones and Stephen Graham

programme.title: Tokyo Vice
programme.desc: Jake has been shut out by Katagirl after his mistake, so he throws himself into helping Emi at the paper. Samantha grows ever more worried about Polina, who has been missing for days. Sato feels the pull of his real family, and questions his commitment to the Yakuza

programme.title: Putin vs the West
programme.desc: The inside story of how Western countries have struggled to deal with Russia leader Vladimir Putin, as told by the presidents and prime ministers who have clashed with him. The first edition looks at the West's response to Russia's invasion of Crimea in 2014, with key players including David Cameron, Francois Hollande, Jose Manuel Barroso, and Ukraine's then-president Petro Poroshenko reflecting on the EU's indecision and the all-night negotiations with the warring parties

programme.desc: Rescuers in South Africa try to combat Broken Heart Syndrome in wild dogs separated from their families. In Wyoming scientists discover the tiny swift fox's chances of survival can depend on their personality. In the mountains of Japan a naturalist is on the hunt for the extinct Japanese Wolf after an encounter that he believes proves they still exist. Conservationists in North America are in a race against time to save the red wolf as less than 20 remain in the wild.

programme.title: Wonders of the Monsoon
programme.desc: The other side of the monsoon, as the winds bring dry air and drought. Budgerigars swarm in the Australian desert, gathering at a precious waterhole, and although birds of prey try to ambush them, they are mesmerised by the array of bright colours on show. On the island of Borneo, a bearded pig hunts for seafood on the beach, while in the Rajasthan desert, nomads haggle over the price of camels, which can provide vital transport during this lean season. The mugger crocodiles of Sri Lanka stalk the animals taking a much-needed drink and a young leopard learning to hunt discovers there is no such thing as an easy meal. Colin Salmon narrates

programme.title: Make Me a Dealer
programme.desc: Paul Martin teaches two would-be antiques dealers the tricks of the trade, pitching Piers Taberham from Southampton against Krystal Allen from Belfast, before an auction showdown

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: At the Old College in Aberystwyth, Raj Bisram is intrigued by a 19th-century sewing box, and Christina Trevanion is wowed by a sapphire and diamond ring. Meanwhile, presenter Paul Martin visits a Regency restoration project at the National Botanic Garden of Wales

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Ronni Ancona, Nathan Caton, Colin Murray and Sally Phillips go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick delves into the stories of those who worked in Cornwall's mines, from the men who laboured beneath the earth's surface to the young women who earned their living breaking rocks with heavy sledgehammers. He also visits a maker of botanical spirits, and adds a cheeky nip to his clementine trifle

programme.title: Saving Lives at Sea
programme.desc: On Cornwall's Perranporth beach, a team of RNLI lifeguards battle to save a mother and her son who are caught in a rip current. Meanwhile in Swanage, the crew respond to multiple 999 calls from a man who has fallen over 100 feet from the top of a local landmark, and the Chiswick and Teddington crews face an unusual challenge on the Thames

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The three remaining chefs from the North West prepare their mains and desserts. Inspired by the original illustrations of the Mad Hatter's tea party in Alice in Wonderland, one chef presents a barbecue poussin stuffed with chicken and trufflemousse, polenta playing cards and rich gravy. For dessert there's a celebration of Bob the Builder with a builder's tea and brown butter ice-cream, a Peruvian chocolate and rolled pionono dessert celebrating Paddington, and a Pingu-inspired chocolate egg

programme.title: Surgeons: At the Edge of Life
programme.desc: The Addenbrooke's trauma surgeons take two patients from resus to the operating theatre to give them life-saving treatment. The first is 55-year-old Carolyn, who has been involved in a road traffic accident. Despite a cerebral bleed, her most critical injuries are to her pelvis and her heel, which has an open fracture. Meanwhile, 75-year-old Joan has been knocked over by a van, leaving her with multiple injuries. The main question is whether her foot, which has lost a lot of skin, can be saved

programme.title: Our Flag Means Death
programme.desc: After Blackbeard's old pal Calico Jack pays a visit to the Revenge, Stede begins to feel like a third wheel. In his despair over Jim's absence, Oluwande gives his room to Frenchie and Wee Jack, who relish the opportunity to design their new space. Meanwhile, Jim returns to Jackie's for more information on the men they seek

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important international news stories. With Kirsty Wark and Mark Urban

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Ukraine: The People's Fight
programme.desc: Documentary following a group of volunteer special forces on Ukraine's southern front as they begin the push to retake Kherson. In charge of these inexperienced forces is military commander Hummer, and as time passes the new recruits prove increasingly effective in pushing back Russian forces. But it comes at a cost, particularly when Hummer realises he knows one of these inexperienced recruits

programme.title: Edie (2017)
programme.desc: Seeking to fulfil a decades-old dream to climb a mountain in the Scottish Highlands, Edith Moore, an 83-year-old widow, escapes to Scotland, where she grudgingly accepts the help of Jonny, the manager of a struggling shop that sells outdoor gear. Drama, starring Sheila Hancock and Kevin Guthrie

programme.title: The Shamima Begum Story
programme.desc: At 15, Shamima Begum left London to join the terror group Islamic State. It made global headlines. Four years later, pregnant with her third child, Begum emerged from the ashes of the so-called caliphate, desperate to come home. But she showed little remorse for her time with the group. For the first time, she's given her account of what happened since 2014 to investigative journalist Josh Baker

programme.title: The Travelling Auctioneers
programme.desc: In East Sussex, a brush with ill-health has forced Lindy to re-evaluate the things that matter in life and now, so with Christina Trevanion and Will Kirk's help, she and partner Rob are hoping to sell the antiques they've squirrelled away over the years and raise enough money to find a permanent place to call home. While Will saves a wooden box and a broken chair, his antique-hunting companion finds a collection of glass and potentially valuable art nouveau items. A dragonfly theme needs further investigation, but time is ticking ahead of the mobile auction rolling into nearby Herstmonceux Castle

programme.title: Saved and Remade
programme.desc: A Swiss clock that caused a couple's first argument 40 years ago, an upright piano and a collection of skateboards in need of a new purpose are among the transformations

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo arrives in Newport, Gwent, where he learns about the heroism of a young boy who was awarded the Albert Medal, before visiting a cinema dating from 1912 in Clevedon

programme.title: The Joy of Painting
programme.desc: Bob Ross offers further advice as he paints another picture, creating a mountain scene with soft, sloping grass cover, a crystal lake and rocky banks

programme.title: The Impressionists - Painting and Revolution
programme.desc: Waldemar Januszczak examines the movement's final years, using the artists' last exhibition as a starting point. He explores Van Gogh's time in Paris, how Monet's water lily paintings were affected by his cataracts, and the ways in which Seurat was influenced by academic training and fellow painters. He also finds out how new discoveries in light and optics played a part in the impressionists' images

programme.title: Turner: The Man Who Painted Britain
programme.desc: Tim Marlow presents this documentary drama chronicling the highs and lows of JMW Turner's life, including his tragic childhood, secret affairs and the exhausting extremes to which he pushed himself to capture a unique quality in his paintings. Ross Boatman stars as the artist

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: Two Russian film-makers follow the impact of the war inside their country. Their documentary finds that while thousands have fled, those that stayed have had to choose - to oppose, support or stay silent

programme.title: Big Sky, Big Dreams, Big Art: Made in the USA
programme.desc: Waldemar Januszczak examines the golden age of American art, beginning in the Wild West with the art of the Hudson River School, before culminating in a celebration of the work of Jackson Pollock, a native of Wyoming who was heavily influenced by the mood of the American West and the example of Native American artists

programme.title: Romancing the Stone: The Golden Ages of British Sculpture
programme.desc: Alastair Sooke examines the three 'golden ages' of British sculpture and the technical breakthroughs that made them possible. He begins with a look at the Norman ecclesiastical building programme and the masterworks created by anonymous medieval masons and artisans to the glory of God - until Henry VIII's Reformation brought wholesale destruction

programme.title: The Impressionists - Painting and Revolution
programme.desc: Waldemar Januszczak examines the movement's final years, using the artists' last exhibition as a starting point. He explores Van Gogh's time in Paris, how Monet's water lily paintings were affected by his cataracts, and the ways in which Seurat was influenced by academic training and fellow painters. He also finds out how new discoveries in light and optics played a part in the impressionists' images

programme.title: Turner: The Man Who Painted Britain
programme.desc: Tim Marlow presents this documentary drama chronicling the highs and lows of JMW Turner's life, including his tragic childhood, secret affairs and the exhausting extremes to which he pushed himself to capture a unique quality in his paintings. Ross Boatman stars as the artist

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels between Taunton and Newton Abbot. Along the way he joins in with a fertility dance in Stogumber, visits a celebrated garden at Hestercombe to discover the fruits of an unusual partnership, and enjoys a trip aboard the longest heritage line in England

programme.title: The Joy of Painting
programme.desc: Bob Ross paints a scene in which he shows how the exciting colours of autumn can be captured on canvas

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Lionel invites Jean to his publisher's party, where they are both made to feel their age, but realise they still have a lot in common. Comedy about late-blossoming love, with Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer

programme.title: The Mistress
programme.desc: The second series of Carla Lane's love triangle comedy, starring Felicity Kendal, Peter McEnery and Jane Asher. From 1987

programme.title: A History of Britain by Simon Schama
programme.desc: The feud between Queen Elizabeth I, a resourceful and ruthless monarch who had the difficult task of ruling a Protestant state in a climate still strongly influenced by Catholicism and her cousin Mary, Queen of Scots, whose conspiring ultimately led to her execution. Simon Schama questions whether Elizabeth's eventual victory over her rival rang hollow, given that Mary was mother to the main contender for the throne

programme.title: Gettys: The World's Richest Art Dynasty
programme.desc: Documentary looking at the cultural impact of the Gettys, who speak about their personal milestones in art collecting and philanthropy. They also discuss some of the family nightmares that have shaped common public perceptions of them, most infamously the kidnapping of John Paul Getty III in 1973

programme.title: Africa with Ade Adepitan
programme.desc: An exploration of the continent in which Ade examines how African nations may influence international affairs in the next 50 years as life expectancy, population, and economic growth rise. He starts by travelling from Cape Verde to his birthplace in Nigeria, passing through Senegal and Ivory Coast along the way. He discovers how a region once ravaged by the slave trade is still being exploited by Western companies, who dominate the fishing trade, plays a game of para soccer on the streets of Lagos and works with salt collectors at Senegal's Lake Retba

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels between Taunton and Newton Abbot. Along the way he joins in with a fertility dance in Stogumber, visits a celebrated garden at Hestercombe to discover the fruits of an unusual partnership, and enjoys a trip aboard the longest heritage line in England

programme.title: Front Row Late
programme.desc: After migrating to Britain from Australia in the 1960s, Clive James established himself as a caustic and charismatic commentator on popular culture and a pioneer of TV criticism. In his heyday he was one of the most famous faces on British TV, and secured access to some of the biggest stars of the day, including Mel Brooks, Jane Fonda and Frank Sinatra. Here Mary Beard talks to the author, critic and broadcaster in a programme first broadcast in 2018

programme.title: Gettys: The World's Richest Art Dynasty
programme.desc: Documentary looking at the cultural impact of the Gettys, who speak about their personal milestones in art collecting and philanthropy. They also discuss some of the family nightmares that have shaped common public perceptions of them, most infamously the kidnapping of John Paul Getty III in 1973

programme.title: A History of Britain by Simon Schama
programme.desc: The feud between Queen Elizabeth I, a resourceful and ruthless monarch who had the difficult task of ruling a Protestant state in a climate still strongly influenced by Catholicism and her cousin Mary, Queen of Scots, whose conspiring ultimately led to her execution. Simon Schama questions whether Elizabeth's eventual victory over her rival rang hollow, given that Mary was mother to the main contender for the throne

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: On the trail of an historic achievement made at the dawn of the Edwardian era, Michael Portillo investigates the first radio signal to be sent across the Atlantic. Then, in Plymouth, he uncovers what happened to surviving crew members of the most famous ocean liner in history, the Titanic. Later, at Fowey, the former politician rediscovers a lost literary figure known as Q, who immortalised the town in his novels

programme.title: The Joy of Painting
programme.desc: Bob Ross paints an image of crashing waves in the moonlight, and demonstrates what can be achieved when painting on to a black canvas

programme.title: Michael Palin's New Europe
programme.desc: The veteran traveller completes his journey around eastern Europe. He learns how to skin a pig and make sausages in the Tatra mountains of Slovakia, enjoys a mud bath with the 2006 Miss World Tatana Kucharova in the spa town of Karlovy Vary and visits Turba's famous mime school in the Czech Republic. Finally, he travels to the holiday complex at Prora on the island of Rug, Germany, which was built by Hitler for his 'Strength Through Joy' programme

programme.title: The 1951 Festival of Britain: Brave New World
programme.desc: Documentary exploring how the 1951 Festival of Britain helped the nation to look forward to a brighter future during a period of post-war austerity. Archive footage and personal testimonies reveal how, despite widespread debt and rationing, the event encouraged people to have fun through design and ingenuity

programme.title: Edge of Darkness
programme.desc: Civil servants Harcourt and Pendleton back Craven's attempts to discover why Emma broke into the Northmoor nuclear plant, and before long a man he once jailed is implicated in her murder. Meanwhile, CIA agent Darius Jedburgh presses ahead with his own investigation

programme.title: Edge of Darkness
programme.desc: Craven hacks into MI5's computer database and discovers a route into the Northmoor nuclear plant, while the President orders Jedburgh to get proof of Grogan's illegal activities - by stealing his plutonium. Bob Peck and Joe Don Baker star in Troy Kennedy-Martin's award-winning political thriller

programme.title: The Story of Welsh Art
programme.desc: Huw Stephens explores how, from the 18th-century, the dramatic landscape of Wales captivated artists like Richard Wilson and JMW Turner, who painted it in ways that changed the course of art history. Huw also discovers the work of Penry Williams, a Merthyr Tydfil artist who was commissioned to paint his home town's vast Cyfarthfa ironworks

programme.title: My Life
programme.desc: Coding Genius follows 11-tear-old Emmanuella, who has a passion for coding. She hit the headlines in the UK after setting up lessons for school kids like her and is determined to go further. Now based in the Nigerian capital Abuja, Emmanuella has work to do - she wants to pass on her love of coding to other girls in the city and launches CodeKid, an after-school, weekend and holiday club for girls aged 6 - 15. But will they turn up, or will the thought of coding keep them away? In this short film, we find out what started Emmanuella's love of coding, and get to know her extraordinary ambitions for changing the world, one coding club at a time.

programme.title: Newsround
programme.desc: The war in Ukraine is the biggest in Europe since World War II. Millions of children have been forced to leave their homes to escape the fighting, but many either others couldn’t or didn’t. Hearing from just some of those who are living through war, this film lets the children caught in the conflict tell their stories in their own words. Covering fear, loss, strength and hope, they detail the life-changing events of the war and the impact it is having on their day-to-day life. They share their experiences of surviving attacks from the air, being forced to live for weeks at a time in bomb shelters, and their towns and villages becoming occupied by Russian soldiers. Ricky Boleto finds out how the children are coping with living in a country at war.

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: Delving into the not-so-easy lives of children throughout history, from the strict parenting of ancient civilisations, to the terrible fights the young King Louis XIV had with his little brother - even weeing on each other's beds. programme.desc: Delivery Duckling arrives and tells Love Monster he has been chosen to be sipping host at a special Hot Chocolate Day ceremony. She then cycles off before telling him what a sipping host does. Love Monster goes to Elder Panda to ask his advice, and he tells him there are many ways to serve hot chocolate - each person needs to find their own unique way. Elder Panda adds honey and banana from his garden to his. Love Monster starts the ceremony by adding his signature marshmallows, but then Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny announces she puts marshmallows in hers too. Love Monster thinks he needs to use something more unusual, so he adds pickles, but this doesn't go down well - in fact, it tastes horrible! It turns out the reason why he was chosen was so that he could make hot chocolate the way he always makes it. He does, and everyone loves it.

Xuli is water-skiing further downstream in the open waters of Crystal Bay, while Foz and Ubercorn watch on from Jet Pad. Grandmaster Glitch is taking the tourist family on a mermaid spotting tour of Crystal River aboard his Grimmer-boat. As Glitch heads off in search of real mermaids, he accidentally startles the mother manatee. Ubercorn realises the manatee will be in danger from the speeding boats and from the cold deep water. The Go Jetters need to mount a manatee rescue quickly. While Xuli attempts to stop the speedboats, Foz launches the Vroomster. The baby manatee has become attached to Kyan, so Lars suggests he remains with her, while Lars and Foz go to save the mother. Kyan is not happy at having to play baby-sitter.

Then Diesel has to alert Rayane when the washing machine is finished so he can hang his football kit up to dry. programme.title: Love Monster
programme.desc: Elder Panda is teaching Love Monster to fly a kite. Love Monster loves to watch it swish around in the air. Elder Panda goes off to get some froyo, which is perfect on Kite Day. Before he goes, he tells Love Monster that soon it will be time for him to go on to his next kiting challenge. Love Monster looks at all the other kites and sees the dragon kite, which is the largest kite of them all. Love Monster’s small kite doesn’t seem that exciting any more. He decides to try the dragon kite for just a minute. At first it seems easy, but then a wind gets it tangled in a tree. The rope breaks, and the kite flies off, causing mayhem in Fluffytown with everyone thinking it is a real dragon invasion. Finally, Elder Panda arrives and manages to bring it down to the ground using an umbrella, and Love Monster comes clean, saying how sorry he is. Elder Panda is disappointed but he does understand, as he too wanted to fly before he could run, but sometimes you have to start small before going big.

programme.title: The Toddler Club
programme.desc: Nigel, Benjee Bear and Bailee Bear welcome toddlers Layla, Maisy, Chester and Francis, and their grown-ups, to the Toddler Club. Parents, carers and their little ones at home are invited to join in with all the fun activities too! The What’s in the Box? game reveals a wooden triangle toy, and when the toddlers and parents open up a bigger box, they discover lots more objects and toys that are inspired by shapes. This theme is explored through play, song and story. Grown-ups are encouraged to take part at home by hiding a safe, toddler-appropriate shapes toy or object inside a recycled box for them to reveal and explore with their toddler. Storytime is all about discovering new words, as Benjee Bear and Bailee Bear look for lots of different shapes at home and when they’re out and about. Viewers at home show how they’ve been exploring the shapes theme too. Plus, The Circle Song gets everyone moving about, before some calm time with stretching and the Goodbye song.

Then she has to help Dr Amit pick up the cake from the supermarket bakery and find the party hats. But the party hats have been moved! Kika must use all her powers to find them. programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: PG Tips and Lipton's are world-famous tea brands and an undercover investigation reveals that women working on plantations producing them are being pressured to have sex with their bosses in return for work. The report focuses on plantations that have been owned for years by two British companies - Unilever and James Finlay and Company - who between them have produced half the tea drunk in the UK. programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles meets Kettering mum of four Lindsey, who married her ex-Royal Engineer husband Shaun in December 2019, after which they began to extend their Kettering home. But a few months later Shaun was struck down with cancer, and died in November 2021, leaving Lindsey and her children with an unfinished home. But help is on hand as the DIY SOS team, along with hundreds of local trades and several of Shaun's old army buddies, step in to finish the job

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Panorama follows the lives of five Ukrainians during the war with Russia over the last year including a paramedic on the frontline, a wedding-turned-war photographer, a TV presenter who rescues civilians under fire, a 19 year-old army volunteer and a young couple who's home town has now been occupied by Russian forces. This personal and powerful documentary marks the first anniversary of the war

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Dark Land: Hunting the Killers
programme.desc: The team try to solve the eight decade old murder-mystery of Joyce Cox. After the four year-old disappeared in 1939 her body was found on a railway line just a few hundred yards from her home in Whitchurch but her killer was never caught. Despite the passage of time, new evidence comes to light that might help the team finally solved the case as the last person to see Joyce alive talks for the first time about that day

programme.title: Bad Education
programme.desc: Stephen wants to turn the school play into a showcase for his talents to impress an agent, but Hoburn has more sinister plans to use it as a way of closing the school down

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Suki accuses Karen of stealing and Linda is torn on her decision of selling Mick's half of The Vic. Denise agrees to meet Ravi at a hotel and Sharon and Keanu agree to go on a date

programme.title: Legends of Welsh Sport
programme.desc: A profile of the rugby star, who was born in Cardiff to Windrush generation parents and witnessed racism at first hand, but made sporting history by scoring three tries at the inaugural Rugby World Cup in 1987. He also became a role model for players like Gareth Thomas who dared to be different

programme.title: Scarlett's Driving School
programme.desc: Fifty-six-year-old Linda is desperate to get a driving licence so she can help look after her grandchildren, but as an 'older learner' who is hard of hearing she has failed her test six times. Teaching Linda is her 53-year-old sister Debbie, but after three years in the car together, both of them are at the end of their tethers. Can five days at Scarlett's Driving School help create some calm in the car, and more importantly give Linda the parking and navigation skills she needs to pass at her seventh attempt?

programme.title: Sort Your Life Out with Stacey Solomon
programme.desc: Stacey Solomon coaches the Smith family through a mammoth declutter as their possessions are laid out in a warehouse as though it were an art installation they discover 207 loose nappies, 145 Punjabi suits and 24 old toothbrushes amongst other things. Things get emotional as Raaj lets go of some of her late sister's belongings whom she lost to Covid two years ago. Carpenter Rob works hard to make their three bedroom hose fit six people and Dilly creates a brand-new larder while reorganising the kitchen

programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: The Traitors US

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedians Lucy Beaumont and Desiree Burch, Strictly judge Anton Du Beke and actor Ralf Little join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the offbeat panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory, through rounds such as Home Truths and Quick-fire Lies

programme.desc: Nicki Chapman helps a London couple search for a new home in Devon, but they need help figuring out what they do and don't want from their move to the country. Away from the search, Nicki visits a workshop where traditional sign-writing skills are being kept alive

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: David Harper and Catherine Southon kick off a week of treasure hunting in Kent, where Catherine fancies her chances with a menagerie of mechanical animals, while David's strategy is to try his luck with some very unfashionable items - as well as a hammer that would put any auctioneer's gavel to shame

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Jermaine Jenas present the first visit of the week to the One Show studio, featuring the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Sharon and Keanu share a passionate reunion but their joy is shortlived when Sharon hears about Nish and Suki's offer on The Vic. Denise is left conflicted when she drunkenly makes a move on Ravi and he turns her down. The ladies of Walford settle in for a lock-in but it becomes apparent that everything can change in a flash

programme.title: Food Fest Scotland
programme.desc: Edith Bowman takes Colin Murray on a food adventure in her home town of Anstruther. As well as its famous fish and chips, they discover how artisan bread is being made for the community. Farmer Jim Smith tests his tastebuds with some hot sauces and discovers the secrets of marmalade. Chef Julie Lin is in Dundee finding out how bakers keep up with demand around the clock

programme.title: Better
programme.desc: Lou struggles to keep up appearances with Col, inviting further suspicion. Desperate to get away from him and clear her conscience, she seeks help from an unexpected source. Bulgey and Artem pay Jade Wilkes a visit to determine whether she revealed the whereabouts of Noel's safehouse to anyone. Drama, starring Leila Farzad

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: PG Tips and Lipton's are world-famous tea brands and an undercover investigation reveals that women working on plantations producing them are being pressured to have sex with their bosses in return for work. The report focuses on plantations that have been owned for years by two British companies - Unilever and James Finlay and Company - who between them have produced half the tea drunk in the UK. Reporter Tom Odula has spoken to dozens of women who say they have been sexually assaulted or harassed, while undercover footage reveals how one young woman was targeted for sex at a job interview
