programme.desc: There are multiple casualties when an explosion rips through a medical conference with no known cause and some of the Mill staff are caught up in the carnage

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Farmer Rhian and her children take their sheep to be judged at the Mid-Somerset Show. Dairy farmer Fred is also returning to defend his championship title, so the pressure is on

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman helps a London couple search for a new home in Devon, but they need help figuring out what they do and don't want from their move to the country. Away from the search, Nicki visits a workshop where traditional sign-writing skills are being kept alive

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: David Harper and Catherine Southon kick off a week of treasure hunting in Kent, where Catherine fancies her chances with a menagerie of mechanical animals, while David's strategy is to try his luck with some very unfashionable items - as well as a hammer that would put any auctioneer's gavel to shame

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Work colleagues Hannah, Claire, Katy and Sally compete for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with co-host Alex Brooker

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Jermaine Jenas present the first visit of the week to the One Show studio, featuring the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Sharon and Keanu share a passionate reunion but their joy is shortlived when Sharon hears about Nish and Suki's offer on The Vic. Denise is left conflicted when she drunkenly makes a move on Ravi and he turns her down. The ladies of Walford settle in for a lock-in but it becomes apparent that everything can change in a flash

programme.title: The Chronicles of Belfast
programme.desc: The seasonal account of the city ends in winter, when despite the challenges of the cold, wet weather, there is a lot going on in the wilder parts of the city. In Colin Glen, Alannah and Paul search the river for fossils washed down from the hills by the rainfall, while glass artist Dagmara shows her garden, which she has turned into a personal nature reserve. Up on Black Mountain Aaron organises a group of schoolchildren to plant 100 trees - and his conservation work does not go unrecognised

programme.title: Food Fest Northern Ireland
programme.desc: Colin Murray visits the Walled City Market in Londonderry, where he finds out about a brown sauce revival and the advantages of getting fish from a fishmonger. He also goes in search of the perfect Irish stew and finds out which tasty street food was brought here by a well-travelled entrepreneur. Ryan Hand gets to grips with Japanese food and chef Suzie Lee reveals how Greek-style yoghurt is being made in County Down

programme.title: Better
programme.desc: Lou struggles to keep up appearances with Col, inviting further suspicion. Desperate to get away from him and clear her conscience, she seeks help from an unexpected source. Bulgey and Artem pay Jade Wilkes a visit to determine whether she revealed the whereabouts of Noel's safehouse to anyone. Drama, starring Leila Farzad

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: PG Tips and Lipton's are world-famous tea brands and an undercover investigation reveals that women working on plantations producing them are being pressured to have sex with their bosses in return for work. The report focuses on plantations that have been owned for years by two British companies - Unilever and James Finlay and Company - who between them have produced half the tea drunk in the UK. Reporter Tom Odula has spoken to dozens of women who say they have been sexually assaulted or harassed, while undercover footage reveals how one young woman was targeted for sex at a job interview

programme.title: Go Hard or Go Home
programme.desc: Bobsleigher Adele Nicoll, ex-footballer Ashley Cain, former rugby player Heather Fisher, MMA star Leah McCourt, Muay Thai fighter Nesrine Dally, Olympic gymnast Nile Wilson and fitness trainers Tyrone Brennand and Waz Ashayer set out to change eight contestants' lives - and help them push themselves to their absolute limit. Presented by Jordan North and Paul Olima

programme.title: Go Hard or Go Home
programme.desc: After their individual training sessions, the trainees take on their first head-to-head challenge - a seemingly simply battle to be the first to grab a mallet, get past their opponent and bang a gong. Back at the hacienda, the winners are treated to a slap-up meal served by the losers, although not everyone sees the funny side

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Judi Dench talks about her heart-warming film Allelujah, while Paul Rudd and Michael Douglas - stars of Marvel's Ant-Man and the Wasp: Quantumania - also pop in for a chat. Greatest Showman Hugh Jackman talks about his role in The Son, a powerful drama about fatherhood, Michael B Jordan promotes boxing sequel Creed III, while Eugene Levy discusses his new TV series The Reluctant Traveller. Plus, there's music from P!nk, who performs her new single Trustfall

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Gethin Jones and Sam Quek present the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Caught Red Handed
programme.desc: A woman suspects a workman in her garden is guilty of a crime and a council witness the worst fly-tipper they've ever seen. Plus a burglar has a painful encounter with a tree

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: A woman pursuing an £800,000 claim after a factory accident is caught out on camera and two men trying to cash in on a car crash are exposed as liars. An inmate in a high security prison ends up in hot water after falling on a wet floor and a driver who ran up £134,000 in hire car charges after claiming his vehicle isn't roadworthy gets caught in a lie. A footballer scores an own goal when his posts on social media ruin his claim for whiplash

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts and the team explore a property with an impressive view on the east coast of Scotland, several properties in Norwich and a trio of terraces in Sheffield

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles hosts the show from Norfolk's biggest Antique Centre in King's Lynn. Experts Caroline Hawley and Mark Stacey assist the Reds and the Blues as they do battle

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Zara deals with the aftermath of the explosion, while Daniel tries to get everyone to speak to a counsellor - with differing results. Rob and Jimmi help a police officer who was part of the rescue team in the explosion, but all is not what it seems

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Two farming couples brave the elements at Lewes Farmers' Market, East Sussex, in the hope that customers will turn up to buy their slow-grown lamb and quality beef

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton hops between Herefordshire and neighbouring counties to help a buyer from Guernsey find a perfect property in the countryside on a budget of £500,000

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Catherine and David head to Sussex and find themselves feeling nostalgic. David has a flashback to his school cricket team giving an unwise demonstration in a room full of china and Catherine has a hankering for items with an aeronautical theme

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Alan, Lin, Sharon and Nicola compete for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Alex Brooker

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Lauren Laverne and Jermaine Jenas present another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Kim is seeking a Walford man to take part in her livestream and Ravi tries to patch things up with Denise. Sharon asks Phil for business advice and realises she's still in love with Keanu. Meanwhile, Karen worries about Kat when she asks to reduce her hours at the launderette

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles meets Kettering mum of four Lindsey, who married her ex-Royal Engineer husband Shaun in December 2019, after which they began to extend their Kettering home. But a few months later Shaun was struck down with cancer, and died in November 2021, leaving Lindsey and her children with an unfinished home. But help is on hand as the DIY SOS team, along with hundreds of local trades and several of Shaun's old army buddies, step in to finish the job

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Panorama follows the lives of five Ukrainians during the war with Russia over the last year including a paramedic on the frontline, a wedding-turned-war photographer, a TV presenter who rescues civilians under fire, a 19 year-old army volunteer and a young couple who's home town has now been occupied by Russian forces. This personal and powerful documentary marks the first anniversary of the war

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Restoration Rescue
programme.desc: Patrick Bradley transforms a derelict cottage and barn on his family farm in Maghera. With no one having lived there for over 100 years and only being used as storage and shelter for animals since, he plans to make the buildings family spaces again. With so much family history tied up in the fabric of the buildings, Patrick feels the pressure to get the restoration right for the generations before him and those to come

programme.title: Bad Education
programme.desc: Stephen wants to turn the school play into a showcase for his talents to impress an agent, but Hoburn has more sinister plans to use it as a way of closing the school down

programme.title: Go Hard or Go Home
programme.desc: One trainee leaves the island at the first Warrior Summit after the Earth Element Challenge in which the trainees have to build and climb a 13 metre bamboo ladder to escape one of the island's deepest caves. The two who take the longest to escape are evaluated and one is voted out

programme.title: The Apprentice
programme.desc: The remaining candidates are tasked to design a new lunchbox aimed at six-to-eight-year-olds, along with an app to encourage healthy eating. For one team, a clear vision helps them take a bite out of the market, though poor decisions and a lack of vision on the other side leads to dreary designs. In the boardroom there's no such thing as a free lunch, as one candidate is dismissed at the hands of Lord Sugar

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Sam Quek and Gethin Jones present the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Caught Red Handed
programme.desc: A former magistrate finds burglars brazenly carrying a safe out of her home and a young cashier teams up with his aunt to rugby tackle an armed robber

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: A family get caught in a £20,000 food poisoning scam and investigators catch a taxi driver out after discovering his history involving 20 previous accidents. An injured inmate who wanted £8,000 after taking a tumble in his cell has his claim stopped in its tracks and two men who invented injuries to claim on a car crash are exposed and ordered to pay thousands. A builder claiming £12,000 after tripping at work slips up when he claims the fall ruined his holiday

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell examine the potential of properties in Plymouth, Wallasey in Merseyside and Tufnell Park in north London. All are sold at online auctions by developers hoping to make a profit on their investment buys

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Host Anita Manning visits the Elsecar Heritage Centre in South Yorkshire, where Tim Weeks and Caroline Hawley help two teams scour an antiques fair and pick up bargains to sell for profit at auction. Anita also pays a visit to one of Europe's largest houses

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Rob struggles to adjust to living with Scarlett, Emma challenges Luca to cook a meal and Bear is caught between two old friends in the middle of a marriage breakdown

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Sheepdog trialists Ross and James are both joined by their sons as they compete at the Macclesfield Sheepdog Trials, only to face tough competition, bad weather and difficult sheep

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: A couple with two young sons and not enough room in their current home enlist Sonali Shah to help them find a bigger place in the Somerset countryside on a budget of £450,000. Away from the house hunting, Sonali checks out a local project to tackle climate change by planting half a million trees over the next five years

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Catherine and David visit the Isle of Wight. While David finds some Dutch dishes, a Chinese canister and a South Indian lamp, Catherine is pleased with a Scottish Wemyss ware jar

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Jake, Luke, Dean and Shelley compete for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Jermaine Jenas present the magazine show, with stories of interest from around the UK, plus celebrity guests in the studio

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Suki accuses Karen of stealing and Linda is torn on her decision of selling Mick's half of The Vic. Denise agrees to meet Ravi at a hotel and Sharon and Keanu agree to go on a date

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers hosts as five dealers battle each other to buy items brought in by the public including a 1960s swivel chair, a zodiac gyroscope, and a fairground game

programme.title: Scarlett's Driving School
programme.desc: Fifty-six-year-old Linda is desperate to get a driving licence so she can help look after her grandchildren, but as an 'older learner' who is hard of hearing she has failed her test six times. Teaching Linda is her 53-year-old sister Debbie, but after three years in the car together, both of them are at the end of their tethers. Can five days at Scarlett's Driving School help create some calm in the car, and more importantly give Linda the parking and navigation skills she needs to pass at her seventh attempt?

programme.title: Sort Your Life Out with Stacey Solomon
programme.desc: Stacey Solomon coaches the Smith family through a mammoth declutter as their possessions are laid out in a warehouse as though it were an art installation they discover 207 loose nappies, 145 Punjabi suits and 24 old toothbrushes amongst other things. Things get emotional as Raaj lets go of some of her late sister's belongings whom she lost to Covid two years ago. Carpenter Rob works hard to make their three bedroom hose fit six people and Dilly creates a brand-new larder while reorganising the kitchen

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Nolan Live
programme.desc: Stephen Nolan probes the issues that matter to the people of Northern Ireland, focusing on the stories of the week and the people making the headlines in lively debates, with viewers sending in their questions via text, email and tweet

programme.title: The Traitors US
programme.desc: Alliances are broken, and trust is questioned on the penultimate day in the castle. The players have the opportunity to add to the prize pot of $168,800

programme.title: The Traitors US
programme.desc: It's the final day and all that stands between the players and the prize money is the ultimate mission, the final banishing and The Fire of Truth

programme.title: Select Committees
programme.desc: The Treasury select committee session on the latest financial stability reports from the Bank of England with evidence from Andrew Bailey, Governor of the Bank of England, Sam Woods, Deputy Governor for Prudential Regulation at the Bank of England and Chief Executive Officer of the Prudential Regulation Authority, Jonathan Hall, External Member of the Financial Policy Committee and Dame Colette Bowe, External Member of the Financial Policy Committee, from Monday 16 January.

programme.desc: An actress engaged to marry a foreign prince becomes the police's number one suspect in the murder of a shady producer. programme.title: Live Snooker: Players Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of the evening session on day three from Aldersley Village in Wolverhampton, featuring the opening quarter-final, played over the best of 11 frames. Barry Hawkins earned a hard-fought 6-5 victory over Yan Bingtao at this stage last year and went on to finish the tournament as runner-up to Neil Robertson. Jill Douglas presents, with analysis from Stephen Hendry, Alan McManus, Neal Foulds and Ken Doherty, commentary by David Hendon and Phil Yates, and reports from Rob Walker

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: The year 1956 finds jazz-loving clergyman Sidney Chambers attending a talk by Reverend Nathaniel Todd, a member of the formative US civil rights movement. During the event, protestors disrupt the speech and release fireworks, causing the audience to panic. In the chaos, Todd's son Charles is stabbed and killed by an unseen assailant. The murder sees racial tensions spike and Geordie Keating is called in to investigate. Things are further complicated when Sidney finds himself drawn to passionate young activist, and their tentative romance faces pressure from all sides. Robson Green stars, with James Norton, Tessa Peake-Jones, Samuel West and Paterson Joseph

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: With Violet gone, Sidney loses himself in drink. After a heavy whiskey session leaves him without his jacket - and little memory of the night before - he discovers to his horror that he was the last person to see a young woman alive. As he struggles to remember her final words, Geordie grows concerned - both for the murdered girl, so callously abandoned outside a local slum, and for his friend's troubled state of mind. James Norton stars, with Robson Green, Tessa Peake-Jones, Al Weaver and Kacey Ainsworth

programme.desc: Shaun Evans steps into the shoes of John Thaw in this 1965-set prequel to Inspector Morse, playing a younger version of the cerebral detective involved in the hunt for a missing schoolgirl. programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: Leonard gets caught up in an armed robbery at the village post office, and manages to identify the masked culprit. Geordie takes no chances when going to arrest the criminal, who has a record of similarly violent crimes - but is surprised to discover that the suspect has been murdered. Meanwhile, a second robbery occurs, carried out by a man and a woman who have adopted the dead robber's trademark of disguising himself with a gas mask. Back at the Vicarage, the atmosphere is tense between Sidney and Amanda

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: A factory worker dies in what appears to be a drunken accident, but Geordie suspects foul play. However, secret forces are determined to shut down his investigation. programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: It's the start of 1971 - though wearied from the events of the past year, there's no chance of 'light duties' at the CID. Crestfallen and rarely without a scotch in hand, Endeavour finds himself right back in the thick of it when an explosive murder at an Oxford college has potentially far-reaching political ramifications. Meanwhile, the IRA have made a threat against the life of the Oxford Wanderers' star striker, and Endeavour is tasked with the duty of acting bodyguard

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: Sidney tries to put his life in Grantchester behind him by going in search of the man who stole Mrs Maguire's life savings, and ends up finding a new home in a travellers' community. However, he falls under suspicions when a murder rocks the camp. Geordie tracks his friend down and together they set out to solve the mystery - and hopefully give Sidney a sense of purpose in his life

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: Sidney has lost his faith in the church, so decides to resign so he can marry Amanda. His decision is a crushing blow to Mrs Maguire, while Leonard fears the arrival of a less tolerant vicar. Sidney soon finds the community needs him more than ever when a boy is abducted, while Geordie's behaviour grows more and more unstable as he wrestles with family problems. As the divided vicar grows closer to the truth about the missing child, he is forced to choose between love, faith, and loyalty to his troubled friend

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: An actress engaged to marry a foreign prince becomes the police's number one suspect in the murder of a shady producer. Desperate to ensure she escapes prosecution, her wealthy fiance asks Poirot to catch the real killer. Unfortunately, the celebrated detective ends up concluding she has lied - or is an accomplice. David Suchet stars, with Niamh Cusack, Abigail Cruttenden and Sean Pertwee

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: After a quoits match with Aidensfield, the visiting team set off home, but disaster strikes when their coach veers off the road. Meanwhile, Nick gets a cold reception when he meets Jo's parents. Rural police drama, starring Nick Berry, Derek Fowlds, Kazia Pelka and Bill Maynard

programme.title: Live Snooker: Players Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of the evening session on day three from Aldersley Village in Wolverhampton, featuring the opening quarter-final, played over the best of 11 frames. Barry Hawkins earned a hard-fought 6-5 victory over Yan Bingtao at this stage last year and went on to finish the tournament as runner-up to Neil Robertson. Jill Douglas presents, with analysis from Stephen Hendry, Alan McManus, Neal Foulds and Ken Doherty, commentary by David Hendon and Phil Yates, and reports from Rob Walker

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: The year 1956 finds jazz-loving clergyman Sidney Chambers attending a talk by Reverend Nathaniel Todd, a member of the formative US civil rights movement. During the event, protestors disrupt the speech and release fireworks, causing the audience to panic. In the chaos, Todd's son Charles is stabbed and killed by an unseen assailant. The murder sees racial tensions spike and Geordie Keating is called in to investigate. Things are further complicated when Sidney finds himself drawn to passionate young activist, and their tentative romance faces pressure from all sides. Robson Green stars, with James Norton, Tessa Peake-Jones, Samuel West and Paterson Joseph

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: With Violet gone, Sidney loses himself in drink. After a heavy whiskey session leaves him without his jacket - and little memory of the night before - he discovers to his horror that he was the last person to see a young woman alive. As he struggles to remember her final words, Geordie grows concerned - both for the murdered girl, so callously abandoned outside a local slum, and for his friend's troubled state of mind. James Norton stars, with Robson Green, Tessa Peake-Jones, Al Weaver and Kacey Ainsworth

programme.title: The Saint

programme.desc: Two sisters receive unwanted gifts at Christmas - severed human ears. Holmes is enlisted to discover where they came from - and uncovers a disturbing tale of deceit and infidelity. Jeremy Brett stars in his curtain call as the famous detective

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: Jeremy Wade investigates the mysterious deaths of fishermen in Alaska. A recent fatal incident sends him on a search for possible suspects - first through treacherous rapids, then down to the river-mouth where the icy waters are swarming with sharks. Yet it's an unexpected beast, hauled up from the depths, that eventually emerges as his deadliest contender

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: From Canada's waterlogged wilderness come stories of a 20ft lake monster that attacks humans. For freshwater detective Jeremy Wade, investigation turns into obsession as he tries to explain widespread accounts of the aggressive serpent-like beast

programme.title: Magnum, PI
programme.desc: Magnum discovers an elderly woman claiming to be Robin Master's high school teacher actually works for the KGB and is on a mission to assassinate a former freedom fighter in Hawaii

programme.title: The Sweeney
programme.desc: The university branch of a bank is robbed, and though Regan and the Flying Squad catch most of the gang a known killer and his sidekick remain inside holding the manager and two women hostage. John Thaw and Dennis Waterman star

programme.title: Minder
programme.desc: Arthur panics when he learns that there has been a robbery of safety deposit boxes in the City, so places all his savings in the ancient safe at the lock-up. Unfortunately, they soon catch the eye of an old acquaintance from Marbella. George Cole and Dennis Waterman star

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: In Fiji's South Pacific paradise, people are coming under attack. Plunging off the beaten track into the remote mountains of the island's interior, freshwater detective Jeremy battles tropical storms and unforgiving jungles in an all-out search for victims, clues, and culprits. Colourful stories of monstrous fish are woven into the local folklore, but how much of this is fanciful, and how much of it is real?

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: Extreme angler Jeremy Wade investigates the stories behind supposedly deadly freshwater creatures, beginning by examining whether piranhas deserve their fearsome reputation. He travels to Brazil to swim in the Amazon with the fish and incites them into a feeding frenzy, before tracking down survivors and eyewitnesses of attacks

programme.title: Live Snooker: Players Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of day one from Aldersley Village in Wolverhampton, featuring the opening two last-16 matches, played over the best of 11 frames. This is the second of three tournaments that make up the Duelbits Players Series, and Mark Allen took the honours in the opener, the World Grand Prix. He is likely to be among the men to beat once again, along with Masters champion Judd Trump and last year's title-winner here Neil Robertson. Jill Douglas presents, with analysis from Stephen Hendry, Alan McManus, Neal Foulds and Ken Doherty, commentary by David Hendon and Phil Yates, and reports from Rob Walker

programme.title: Mad Max Beyond Thunderdome (1985)
programme.desc: The nomadic warrior pitches up in the city of a cut-throat desert community in search of his stolen vehicle and ends up making a deal with a local dictator to get rid of her rival for power. However, when the bargain turns sour, he is cast out into the wilderness - where he becomes the unlikely protector of a tribe of feral youngsters. Sci-fi adventure sequel, starring Mel Gibson, Tina Turner and Bruce Spence

programme.title: Live Snooker: Players Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of the evening session on day two from Aldersley Village in Wolverhampton, featuring the fifth and sixth last-16 matches, played over the best of 11 frames. programme.title: Arnold Clark Cup Live
programme.desc: Korea Republic Women v Italy Women (Kick-off 4.45pm). Coverage of both teams' final match of the round-robin tournament, held at Ashton Gate in Bristol. The Italians have won both of the previous two meetings between the sides, with the most recent a 2-1 victory in 2015. Laura Woods presents, with analysis from Anita Asante, and commentary by Seb Hutchinson and Lianne Sanderson

programme.title: Sport Filler Shows (2020)

programme.title: Arnold Clark Cup Live
programme.desc: England Women v Belgium Women (Kick-off 7.45pm). All the action from the final match of the round-robin tournament, held at Ashton Gate in Bristol. The sides last met in a warm-up match ahead of England's victorious Euro 2022 campaign, with the Lionesses prevailing 3-0 in Wolverhampton thanks to strikes by Chloe Kelly and Rachel Daly and a late own goal by Nicky Evrard. Laura Woods presents, with analysis from Ian Wright, Eni Aluko and Karen Carney, commentary by Seb Hutchinson and Emma Hayes, and reports from Katie Shanahan

programme.title: Mad Max Beyond Thunderdome (1985)

Sci-fi adventure sequel, starring Mel Gibson, Tina Turner and Bruce Spence

If they manage to solve the mystery, they'll become popular and respected by all the detective story fans, but can they really spill the beans?

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. His genius still unappreciated, Fizz decides to go on a spiritual retreat in a forest clearing, but Mr Magoo, who believes that he's on an orangutan reserve, mistakes the hamster for a feral child.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. Fizz invents the MutoFizz, a device which can render anyone mute... even the President! However, when Mr Magoo gets his hands on the invention, Fizz and Weasel end up mute, and he mistakes them for Parisian mimes.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. While Weasel takes his annual holiday, Fizz tries out the MeteoFizz, which allows him to control the weather - when Mr Magoo finds the remote control of the machine, he is convinced that an interactive treasure hunt has started.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. Fizz wants to win a contest to find the world's most incredible animal, but Mr Magoo appears with Mr Cat while thinking that he's at the groomer's - finding the groomer (Weasel) too overwhelmed, Mr Magoo decides to help out...

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. Fizz steals the President's panda - whoever has an animal that cute will surely attain power and glory, but when the animal escapes Weasel's protection and ends up at Mr Magoo's house, he is mistaken by Mr Magoo for his nephew.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. Fizz's latest invention is derailed and Weasel suddenly becomes very intelligent - he decides to improve Fizz's plans, but the two aren't on the same wavelength... and there's only room for one genius on this planet!

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. Weasel sneezes and Fizz, who is a complete hypochondriac, is convinced that his assistant is sick. Terrified of catching his cold, Fizz desperately tries to escape Weasel, but Mr Magoo shows up intent on pampering his sick neighbour.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. The birthdays of Fizz and Mr Magoo fall on the same day - Mr Cat organises a party for his owner, but Weasel has nothing planned as Fizz has no friends... that is, unless Weasel steals Mr Magoo's guests.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. Fizz wants to trap Mr Magoo - while Weasel captures Mr Cat and sends him to a far-off destination, Fizz demands a ransom from Mr Magoo and sends him an anonymous letter with a meeting point. However, Mr Magoo mistakes the letter for a treasure map...

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. Mr Magoo, who is on the roof of a building, believes he's by the sea - when he dives in to save a drowning swimmer (in reality, a statue in a traffic circle) he is struck by Fizz's laser and then becomes weightless.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. Mr Magoo replaces his friend Serge for the day as a personal trainer - while he thinks he's giving a swimming lesson at the pool, he appears at Weasel's house at the worst moment: for the first time in his life, Fizz is out of ideas...

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. While Mr Magoo prepares for a spin on his new boat (actually a shopping cart), he notices the Aerofizz in the distance - convinced that he's under attack from a ghost ship, Mr Magoo aims to defend the city at all costs.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. During a heatwave, Fizz installs a giant fan at the top of a building under construction to cool down the city while diffusing his scent - however, Mr Magoo, who thinks that he's taking Marnie out for an ice cream, finds himself at the top of the tower instead...

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. In order to abolish work, Fizz has replaced the city's workers with clones, but Mr Magoo mistakes the clones for extraterrestrials, and seeing them working hard, he decides to teach them to relax.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. In order to become a superhero, Fizz invents a scanner that allows him to take on the physical abilities of animals - while he tests his invention in the park, Mr Magoo appears and mistakes Weasel for his personal trainer.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. When a flea epidemic breaks out in the city, Fizz takes advantage of it to invent a flute that repels the parasites - as Weasel is sent to the park to play the instrument, Mr Magoo appears and mistakes his neighbour for a sea lion.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. Mr Magoo finds his childhood puppet and wants to have it repaired, but he turns up at Weasel's house when mistakenly thinking that it's the toy repair shop. In shock, Weasel stuffs Fizz inside the puppet... and Mr Magoo believes that his toy has come to life.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. It's Valentine's Day! While Fizz is in rapture over his Fizzroses, Magoo plans the perfect date for Weasel and Linda as he takes them on a sewer tour.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. To make the world's biggest fries, Fizz invents the Fizzometer. But Weasel messes up and shrinks Fizz! Magoo is fascinated by all things tiny.

programme.desc: The competition begins in Stroud with horse trainer Melanie, who has opted for a quick and easy vegetarian menu so she can focus on a glamorous night of hosting - and partying

programme.title: The Simpsons

programme.title: Hollyoaks

programme.title: Channel 4 News

programme.desc: George meets a woodwork-obsessed 16-year-old who plans to build his own shepherd's hut from scratch, while in Manchester, a young engineer is using cutting-edge technology to create a stylish modern garden office to create a new business to support his young family. In Israel, George visits Tel Aviv to discover how the city is home to the world's greatest collection of Bauhaus buildings and, back in the UK, he discovers a white van that holds a secret - a Tolkien-inspired home hidden inside

programme.title: SAS: Who Dares Wins
programme.desc: The remaining recruits' will to survive is severely tested with an extraction task used in the Vietnam War, and there's an intense beasting in a fight for the survival of the fittest. With the hardships of the jungle closing in, a lack of sleep, a calorie deficit from ration packs, and their bodies starting to fail, will any of the recruits make it through a survival task that requires navigating through the jungle pursued by hunters during a mission behind enemy lines?

programme.title: Everyone Else Burns
programme.desc: The family attends the annual Chapter Congress, when different branches of the church come together - although it soon becomes clear it's more of a battleground than a celebration. However, as Aaron waits to be baptised, his head is turned by one congregation carrying rainbow flags. Fiona and Rachel argue over university

programme.title: Gogglebox

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Fred and the staff serve an extra portion of romance for Valentine's Day and for guests like Brendan who has been on around a thousand dates, it might just be their special night. After an arranged marriage at a young age 42 year-old Annie has been out of the dating game for a long time, will 50 year-old Dave be the man of her dreams? 27 year-old 'clubbing queen' Amanda is fed up of men being too keen too soon, she's hoping club rep Ryan will be different. Special effects make-up artist Erin is looking for a partner to look beyond her disability and see the person she really is

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Northampton, fitness instructor Pam and her boyfriend Glenn kick off the competition with a Spanish fiesta. Finally it's the turn of Wendy and Mark to host, though things don't go quite according to plan

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA

Can the chef break Tom's iron grip on the business and persuade him to change his outdated approach?

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows the progress of two architects who are planning to build an eco-friendly subterranean house underneath a ruined 300-year-old barn in the Cotswolds. In one of the most challenging projects seen on the programme, Helen and Chris Seymour Smith build a steel frame around the barn while they excavate underneath, aiming to create a home that is airtight and needs no heating

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home

Duncan and Josie need to make it liveable very quickly as they welcome their new baby Ruby, so George sets out to make the dark, cramped layout work for modern family living. He also heads to Southport, Merseyside, to see a Victorian gothic property in need of attention. Owners Jenny and Fadi are keen to resore the pile to its original splendor

programme.title: The Great British Dig: History in Your Back Garden

programme.title: Kirstie's House of Craft

The Blue Dahlia (1946)
programme.desc: A war-weary pilot returns home from service in Europe, but his welcome is far from warm. Not only must he deal with the news of his wife's infidelities, but he also finds himself accused of her murder. However, the wife of his dead spouse's lover is on hand to help him prove his innocence. Thriller, written by Raymond Chandler and starring Alan Ladd, Veronica Lake, William Bendix and Doris Dowling

programme.title: 12 Angry Men (1957)
programme.desc: Twelve jurors convene to decide the verdict in a murder trial. While 11 of the group are thoroughly convinced the teenage defendant is guilty, one lone voice of reason refuses to cave in to pressure and passionately argues the case for his innocence. Sidney Lumet's legal drama, starring Henry Fonda, Lee J Cobb, Ed Begley, Martin Balsam and Jack Klugman

programme.title: The Black Shield of Falworth (1954)
programme.desc: The son of a disgraced medieval nobleman is raised in poverty. With the support of a kindly earl, he gains the chance to train as a knight and reclaim his birthright, proving his worth by fighting to foil a plot to overthrow the king. Swashbuckling adventure, starring Tony Curtis, Janet Leigh, David Farrar and Barbara Rush

programme.title: The Tall T (1957)
programme.desc: A ranch hand hitches a ride on a stagecoach after losing his horse, but things go from bad to worse when the vehicle is hijacked by outlaws. The cowboy tries to bargain for the release of his fellow hostages - a newlywed couple - but his pleas fall on stony ground once the bandit leader learns the new bride is a rich heiress. Western, with Randolph Scott, Richard Boone, Maureen O'Sullivan and Henry Silva

programme.title: A Beautiful Day in the Neighborhood (2019)
programme.desc: In 1998, magazine journalist Lloyd Vogel is sent to interview beloved TV entertainer Fred Rogers, an assignment he feels is beneath him. However, a friendship soon forms between the two men. Director Marielle Heller's drama based on a true story, starring an Oscar and Bafta-nominated Tom Hanks, Matthew Rhys and Chris Cooper

programme.title: War for the Planet of the Apes (2017)
programme.desc: A devastating conflict erupts between humans and intelligent primates in a post-apocalyptic future. The leader of the apes is determined to make peace and prove his people are not savages - but a tragic course of events leaves him wrestling with a desire for revenge. Sci-fi adventure sequel, the conclusion of the trilogy of prequels to the 1968 movie. Starring Andy Serkis, Woody Harrelson and Steve Zahn

programme.title: The Untouchables (1987)
programme.desc: Incorruptible federal agent Eliot Ness is assigned the task of fighting organised crime in Prohibition-era Chicago and bringing the notorious crime boss Al Capone to justice. Aware crooked police are undermining his investigations, he puts together his own elite squad to take on the Mob. Brian De Palma's crime thriller, with Kevin Costner, Robert De Niro, Andy Garcia and Sean Connery, who won an Oscar for his performance

programme.title: Skin Trade (2014)
programme.desc: After his family is killed by a Serbian gangster with international interests, a New York detective goes to south-east Asia to team up with a Thai detective to destroy the syndicate's human trafficking network. Thriller, starring Dolph Lundgren, Tony Jaa, Michael Jai White and Ron Perlman

programme.title: Samson and Delilah (1949)
programme.desc: Hebrew warrior Samson becomes a wanted man after crossing paths with Philistine troops, but he constantly thwarts their efforts to capture him using to his incredible strength. Determined to bring him down, the Saran of Gaza makes use of his beguiling sister Delilah, who seduces Samson and manages to rob him of the source of his power. Cecil B DeMille's Oscar-winning adaptation of the biblical tale, starring Victor Mature, Hedy Lamarr, George Sanders, Angela Lansbury and Henry Wilcox

programme.title: Cowboy (1958)
programme.desc: A Chicago hotel clerk befriends a visiting cowboy and soon talks his way into joining him on a cattle drive so he can impress the woman he loves. The tenderfoot has no idea of what awaits him as he ventures out into the Wild West, an experience that forces him to undergo a dramatic change. Western, starring Jack Lemmon, Glenn Ford, Anna Kashfi and Brian Donlevy

programme.title: Reach for the Sky (1956)
programme.desc: Biopic of Second World War hero Douglas Bader. A plane crash in 1931 cost the aspiring pilot both his legs, but after learning to walk on artificial limbs, he went on to become one of the RAF's most decorated heroes. However, more misfortune was in store when he was shot down over occupied France and taken prisoner. Starring Kenneth More, Muriel Pavlow and Alexander Knox

programme.title: Star Trek Into Darkness (2013)
programme.desc: Captain Kirk and the crew of the starship Enterprise are sent on a clandestine mission into enemy territory to track down the rogue Starfleet agent behind a terrorist attack on Earth. However, the assignment brings to light a hidden threat from within their own organisation. Sci-fi adventure sequel, starring Chris Pine, Zachary Quinto and Benedict Cumberbatch

programme.title: Independence Day: Resurgence (2016)
programme.desc: Two decades have passed since Earth was saved from an extraterrestrial invasion, and in the years since, the aliens' salvaged technology has been used to transform the world. However, it may not be enough to save the human race when a second, even deadlier attack begins. Sci-fi adventure, starring Jeff Goldblum, Liam Hemsworth and Bill Pullman

programme.title: 12 Years a Slave (2013)
programme.desc: A free black man living in pre-Civil War New York is abducted and sold into slavery. He spends the next 12 years struggling to survive and maintain his dignity in the face of brutal treatment, while clinging to a desperate hope that he can return to his family. Oscar-winning historical drama based on Solomon Northup's autobiographical book, starring Chiwetel Ejiofor, Michael Fassbender, Benedict Cumberbatch, Lupita Nyong'o and Brad Pitt

programme.title: The Girl and the Spider (2021)
programme.desc: Drama, starring Henriette Confurius. In German with English subtitles

programme.title: The Great Sioux Massacre (1965)
programme.desc: A corrupt senator coaxes Colonel Custer out of retirement with the prospect of presidential office, and the soldier tries to further his political ambitions by wresting control of the current military campaign from its commanding officer, culminating in his last stand at the Battle of the Little Bighorn. Western, with Philip Carey, Joseph Cotten, Darren McGavin and Julie Sommars

programme.title: Gunfight at the OK Corral (1957)
programme.desc: US Marshal Wyatt Earp lays down his badge to live a peaceful life with his brothers in the town of Tombstone. As a feud erupts with the ruthless Clanton gang, he forms an unlikely alliance with hard-drinking gambler Doc Holliday to face them in a historic showdown. Western, starring Burt Lancaster, Kirk Douglas, Dennis Hopper, Lee Van Cleef and DeForest Kelley

programme.title: Father Brown (1954)

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go! (1966)

programme.title: Addams Family Values (1993)
programme.desc: Spooky couple Gomez and Morticia hire a nanny to look after their new baby son - and stop him suffering an early death at the hands of his jealous elder siblings. Romance soon blossoms between the new childminder and Uncle Fester, but he does not realise she is planning to kill him once she has got hold of the family fortune. Comedy sequel, starring Anjelica Huston, Raul Julia, Christopher Lloyd, Christina Ricci and Joan Cusack

programme.title: Mechanic: Resurrection (2016)
programme.desc: Hitman Arthur Bishop's arch-enemy Crain kidnaps his new girlfriend Gina and blackmails him into committing three assassinations in as many days, while making them look like accidents. Action thriller sequel, starring Jason Statham, Jessica Alba, Sam Hazeldine and Tommy Lee Jones

programme.desc: The team investigates a competitive case based in Dorset and use the newly released 1939 register to help unlock a family tree. Their search turns up an uncle of the deceased who was once a naval policeman and as they scour other censuses they discover more and more hidden family members

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Retired professional rugby player Steve Lloyd and his partner Kathy Leather host first, at Copper Beech House in Malvern in Worcestershire. John and Della McGinn are wowed by the decor, but Phil and Sharon Hobson are less impressed by their bathroom. During an afternoon rugby training session, Mark and Lowrie Price surprise their rivals. Foodie John puts Steve to the test at breakfast, and Steve and Kathy find Phil's 'sausage feedback' hard to swallow

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to the pet-friendly Dog in a Doublet in Peterborough, where Della McGinn's passion for animals comes a close second to husband John's passion for food

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week takes place at the Torcroft Boutique B&B in Torquay, south Devon, where Phil and Sharon Hobson hope their added extras will help win over their rivals

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final stay is at the 600-year-old Rhydspence Inn in Herefordshire, where the medieval character proves charming, although the everyday practicalities prove painful for some

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final day of competition sees the B&B owners meet for the last time to find out what they have been paid and to settle some scores. Copper Beech House are first to host and Steve and Kathy want Phil to swallow his synthetic sausage comment

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help two couples searching in Sheffield. Scientists Lois and Ahmed's strategic approach has so far seen them lose out on eight houses, being outbid by just a few thousand pounds each time. With a toddler in tow, and living with Lois's parents, the heat is on for Kirstie to find their own family home. Phil is with Liz and Luke, who are set on the rural areas around the city, close to the Peak District

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer visit the Payne-Durkins, on the rural outskirts of Leeds, to help Karl and Paul decide whether to renovate or sell their three bed home. Karl loves the unique design and idyllic location, but Paul thinks they are too isolated, and would rather move to another area than spend the moving improving their current home

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau
programme.desc: Dick and Angel Strawbridge's to-do list is as long as ever, and with no guests, weddings or events at the chateau thanks to lockdown, they use their engineering and design skills to tackle some major projects. First on the list is transforming one of the old outbuildings into a supersized workshop for chateau-sized jobs. Before work can commence, the floor above must be emptied of decades of debris and, amid the rubbish, Dick and Angel discover that the chateau still has secrets to share

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows the progress of engineer Richard Bennett and his partner Felicia Böhm as they transform an underground water reservoir near the Humber Estuary into a family home. In 2013, the pair decided to embark on the ambitious build with a budget of only £150,000, but it proved a monumental challenge, and design and layout decisions stretched their abilities and the schedule to the max

programme.title: The Royals: A History of Scandals
programme.desc: Dr Nicola Clark, Dr Katie Carpenter, Dr Alexandra Loske and journalist Stephen Bates help Suzannah Lipscomb unpack the stories of how royal marriages across the centuries have proved to be scandalous and intriguing. From the marriage that was deemed so wrong it caused George III to write a new law, to the first 'People's Princess' - Queen Caroline - who was put on trial by her husband George IV, and more recently Princess Margaret and her relationship with Peter Townsend

programme.title: Prince Philip: The Plot to Make a King
programme.desc: Secret History documentary telling the inside story of the dynastic tensions that were unleashed when Princess Elizabeth, the future queen, fell in love with Prince Philip. It was felt that Philip was rough and ill-mannered - and with the Second World War still fresh in most people's minds, the royal and political elite disliked his German roots. But following the death of King George VI in 1952, the establishment feared a dynastic coup, with the Queen torn between the two sides. The documentary examines the complexities and frustrations of the royal marriage, as the monarch struggled to reconcile the love of her husband with the suspicions of her family and her government

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: This edition focuses on the treatment of sport enthusiasts who have had accidents on two wheels. Billy, 19, has been thrown 20ft from his motocross bike during a race, suffering multiple spinal injuries. Teacher Dave, 53, has facial injuries after riding his new bicycle into the back of a stationary car in Richmond Park, while 30-year-old adrenaline junkie and former Royal Marine Richard has badly dislocated his thumb after falling off a bike

programme.title: The Royals: A History of Scandals

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Dave and Debbie Chambers from Redditch, Worcestershire, started their family young, but now their four children have grown up, they've decided to recapture their youth and buy a place in Spain where they can enjoy time in the sun - just the two of them. For their budget of £45,000 Laura Hamilton shows them five apartments in and around the town of Torrevieja, but will any of them be their perfect place?

programme.title: Kirstie's House of Craft
programme.desc: Presenters Rav Wilding and Angelica Bell go head-to-head to make stylish braided coasters

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jo and Ellis from East Sussex cannot wait to buy a holiday home on Spain's Costa Blanca, where they plan to spend every moment in the sunshine indulging their passion for water sports and mountain biking. programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: A campsite owner in Italy is given the runaround by a donkey. There's a bittersweet departure in Portugal, and hosts in France sacrifice their own comfort for their guests' sake

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien come across a gramophone and a stow-away bed to restore. Meanwhile, Simon accidently puts his foot through a drum

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of probate detectives. A man travels 9,000 miles to meet his half-sister for the first time, while a surprise adoption and travelling ancestors threaten to derail the search for a Leicester City fan's heirs

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at the White Horse Inn in Maldon, Essex, where owners Jayne and Pete Kocinoga hope their attention to detail will win over their guests

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the week is to Barnfield B&B in St Osyth, Essex, run by Christine and Paul, where as well as offering rooms, Christine also runs spiritual retreats

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final stay is at Delamere Farm near Peterborough, where proud owner Agi Chapman is sent into a spin after hearing some critical comments over breakfast

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final day arrives, and the hosts of The White Horse Inn, Barnfield B&B, The Black Swan Inn and Delamere Farm all discover just how much their guests valued their services

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Two sets of house-hunters look for properties in north London. Kirstie Allsopp is with single mum and businesswoman Digi, who has £1.25million to find the perfect place for her, daughter Emily and mum Queelan. However, it soon proves a challenge to find the family home that suits all their needs. Phil Spencer helps Rebecca and Sohail, who have raised their family in rented accommodation and now want a place of their own now. The problem is finding a place they will love when their rental is worth at least £200,000 more than their budget to buy

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer meet the Lindleys from Ashtead, Surrey. Having built up his business empire from home, cyber security expert Bill has inadvertently taken over their detached bungalow, and retired civil servant Pippa has had enough. She dreams of moving to Kent, where they can be closer to family and the coast

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau
programme.desc: With autumn just around the corner, it's a chance for the Strawbridge family to make the most of the wild larder on their doorstep. Dick is determined to make sloe gin, while Angel presses on with her plan to create a library in the pepper pot tower

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Bolton-based bricklayer Paul Rimmer, who has spent his career restoring and renovating Victorian terrace houses, sets his sights on constructing a state-of-the-art home on a budget of £350,000. However, instead of using the construction materials he has spent the past 40 years mastering, he has opted to build his new home from wood. Roping in his wife Carol, daughter Abby and a selection of favoured workmates, Paul and his team begin work on the ultra-modern, five-bedroom build, and Kevin McCloud reveals how extreme weather, exhaustion, and rapidly dwindling funds place the entire project in jeopardy

programme.title: Finding the Cornish Dream
programme.desc: Documentary following house-hunters and estate agents in Cornwall's flourishing property scene. In the first episode, a Wiltshire couple view a Grade II listed thatched cottage, and a local resident puts in an offer on a doer-upper with Perranporth coastal views, but faces stiff competition. New residents Rose and Richard look to put their traditional stone cottage on the market after moving to the county during the Covid pandemic

programme.title: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Documentary presenting real-life footage of challenging situations in the workplace, from dangerous encounters in late-night takeaways and corner shops, to messy jobs and tyrannical bosses. The programme features contributions from the employees featured and analysis from psychologists on the anxieties that can influence behaviour in a working environment

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Tree surgeon Paul, 38, is rushed into resus after falling 25ft. He is experiencing shooting pains in his back and pins and needles in his feet, leading to concerns he may have injured his spine. Meanwhile, 66-year-old Anthony, who has recently been diagnosed with Parkinson's disease and prostate cancer, has taken a tumble down a flight of stairs at home. He's very frail and a scan reveals he has broken some ribs, puncturing a lung

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: The paramedics fight to save a man whose heart has stopped for more than 50 minutes, and a young boy is found unconscious in a Coventry park after drinking two litres of whisky. Plus in Birmingham, a 93-year-old grandmother is stranded on the floor

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

programme.desc: Simon O'Brien and Henry Cole visit an East Midlands reclamation yard, where they find a Russian motorbike and sidecar dating back to the Second World War and a 1970s fire surround

programme.title: Heir Hunters

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The latest competition starts at Martyn and Elaine Flint's lovingly decorated, adults-only B&B, the Hillcroft in Torquay. The B&Bers share a lively game of bowls and at dinner, youngsters Sam and Henry's age and experience are subjected to scrutiny. Elaine faces a tough time in the kitchen and the feedback turns up the heat

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer are house-hunting in south London with two couples at different stages of their lives. Jess and Zak are searching in a popular area, and post-lockdown have realised they want a good-sized garden and more space indoors to work from home. Kirstie is with Rachel and Alan, who call themselves the oldest first-time buyers in town. Fed up with paying a whopping £2,000 a month in rent they want their own home - a place they can put their own stamp on

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer meet newlyweds Nikki and Andy Taylor-Myers in Northampton, who have recently merged households and are unhappy in their cluttered terrace. programme.title: Escape to the Chateau
programme.desc: Dick and Angel Strawbridge turn their attentions to the wash house - a shell of an old stone building on the far side of the moat. They have visions of turning it into a bathroom for their 40-foot boat on the moat, complete with all eco-friendly mod cons. And it's not long before the whole family get to work clearing the overgrown site so the project can begin

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets Clinton Dall from West Sussex, a self-made businessman and father of four aiming to build one of the largest homes ever featured on the show. Dall wants the end project to be perfect - from the finish of his mirrored cruciform steel columns, to how the floor tiles line up with the dining room table, and is willing to spend whatever it takes to achieve his vision. However, the construction represents a huge risk, as down one road lies abject failure and financial ruin, while down the other, is the creation of something sublime and almost heroic

programme.title: Amanda Owen's Farming Lives
programme.desc: Amanda visits the Rose family on FarmEco in Nottinghamshire, an eco-focused business and one-stop shop for the community as it hosts several tenant businesses including a sheep farmer and a hair salon. She also turns her hand to woodwork at a workshop session for retired men hosted by a member of the family, goes foraging in an art therapy class and heads to the on-farm hairdressers for a trim

programme.title: The World's Wildest Weather
programme.desc: Footage shot by members of the public of unusual and dangerous weather from around the world, including Alpine avalanches and cyclones in the South Pacific. The programme features first-hand accounts of the events featured and scientific analysis of the footage and how the strange weather conditions came about

programme.title: Billion Pound Cruise
programme.desc: Daily life on the mammoth cruise ship the Symphony of the Seas, which boasts 20 pools and jacuzzis, two surf simulators, a rock-climbing wall, an ice rink, a basketball court and a mini golf course. It's all hands on deck for the crew members as 6,680 passengers arrive for the holiday of a lifetime

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Former boxer Paul, 22, has been stabbed in the face and arm with a broken bottle outside a nightclub in Kingston. As the team works to stop the bleeding and treat the patient's wounds, his girlfriend Naveena reflects on his sensitive side. Angela, 93, is brought to A&E by her daughter Elizabeth after suffering from blood loss and disorientation at her care home, while 70-year-old John arrives with his wife Francesca after falling while out running and dislocating his shoulder. To get John's pain under control quickly the medics give him ketamine, and the hallucinogenic side effects keep everyone entertained

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

programme.title: Cops on the Rock
programme.desc: Customs officers spring into action after news of a sinking boat - on land, Sergeant Steve uses good old-fashioned leg work to track down two stolen scooters

programme.title: Survivor South Africa
programme.desc: More from the show where eyes in the back of your head are quite useful. Jacques' wishes for a tribe swap are finally granted when the tribes are reshuffled into three tribes of six.

programme.title: Rick Stein's Secret France
programme.desc: Rick's journey takes him to the Spanish border and the Mediterranean coast. He discovers how Catalan and French influences have shaped the culinary legacy of Roussillon in the foothills of the Pyrenees, and samples some of the area's famous mountain cuisine, including grilled sausages, snails and fresh fish caught in a self-contained seawater lake - all with generous servings of the region's famous garlic mayonnaise. Back in his country kitchen, Rick prepares pork and beef meatballs in a tomato and piment sauce

programme.title: Special Ops: Crime Squad UK
programme.desc: Britain's most talented detectives pursue two gunmen killers in Northamptonshire, distraction burglars in sleepy Kent, and a multi-million-pound footwear scam in Manchester

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: Meth is found inside a truck driver's speakers, a Mexican boy claiming US citizenship is questioned, and AC units containing drugs are intercepted.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson puts the Kia Cee'd through a rigorous but peculiar road test featuring eels, curry, a rock legend, an American police officer and an unusual game of rugby involving James May. Richard Hammond gets behind the wheel of the Mastretta MXT, but worries about the repercussions of a comment he made in a previous episode about Mexico, the sports car's country of manufacture. Plus, three high-performance hatchbacks are driven with gusto around the test track, and Formula One driver Lewis Hamilton gets a second chance to smash the lap record

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and Richard Hammond try to solve the problems that increasingly complex cars pose to an ageing population. Meanwhile, James May gets acquainted with a revamped Range Rover in London before pitting the luxurious off-roader against an autonomous military machine in Nevada. Actor James McAvoy tackles the test track in the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: James May's Cars of the People
programme.desc: James charts the history of 4x4 vehicles from the jeeps of the Second World war onwards, revealing how they rose in popularity in everyday use and in rallies. He explores the rivalry between Land Rover and Land Cruiser, and puts some classic vehicles through their paces by driving up Mount Fuji and through the Mojave desert

programme.title: QI XL

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee thinks the twins are too young to be taught about sex at school and that their teacher Miss Anstis is too stuck up to teach it. Comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton

programme.desc: The comedian hosts as members of the public are pitted against each other in a quest to predict how search engines respond to a series of questions

He moves on to the harbour town of Cassis to try North African lamb chorba cooked by a local fisherman, while back in his country kitchen, he prepares a confit tomato and aubergine tarte tatin

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson gets behind the wheel of the Ferrari F12 Berlinetta, sampling the punch of its 730bhp V12 engine on the open roads of Scotland. Richard Hammond harnesses the power of motorsport on a quest to find the world's best taxi, and James May pays tribute to the former BBC Television Centre in White City, London, using a motorcyclist and a pair of parkour runners. Plus, the BAC Mono - an astonishingly fast car with just one seat - is put through its paces on the test track, and film director Ron Howard goes for a spin in the new Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: James May's Cars of the People
programme.desc: James looks at some of the advances in motoring that never caught on, revealing how the petrol engine came to dominate in the 20th century, while concepts for jet engines and steam power fell by the wayside. He also drives an amphibious car and an electric scooter, and takes a ride in the world's fastest driverless car

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Josh Widdicombe, Stephen K Amos and Cally Beaton join regular panellist Alan Davies in an extended edition of the unconventional quiz. This time, host Sandi Toksvig's asks questions on the theme of 'Omnishambles', featuring a woman who never knew that she had won an Olympic gold medal and advice on how to throw the two-handed javelin

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: The competitive nature of Taskmaster bubbles alarmingly to the surface as a simple team task involving a hammock exposes tensions between two of the five comics vying to win

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Nihal Arthanayake, Jake Humphrey, Patsy Kensit and Mae Martin go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Comedian and actress Bridget Christie, political correspondent Robert Peston and DJ Greg James tell Frank Skinner what really gets on their wick, in the hope he will banish their bugbears to the infamous room for ever. Their gripes include honeymoons, over-attentive waiters and The Kardashians

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Footballer-turned-property expert Dion Dublin, comedians Bob Mortimer and Lucy Porter, and entertainer Debbie McGee join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show. As usual, the participants aim to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory

programme.title: World's Most Dangerous Roads
programme.desc: Another wild adventure from the hit series - this time sees long-term mates Joe Wilkinson and Zoe Lyons, who've travelled to gigs together for years, take on the wilds of eastern Turkey.

programme.title: Meet the Richardsons

programme.title: Sneakerhead

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: When Charlie's school gets a bad Ofsted rating, Lee and Lucy start looking around for alternative schools. Despite Frank's protests, Geoffrey and Wendy offer to pay to send Charlie to be privately educated, which presents Lee and Lucy with a moral dilemma

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee interrupts Lucy's favourite TV programme by plonking himself down next to her on the sofa, eating her chocolates and talking loudly all the way through the dialogue. programme.desc: Set on beautiful, scattered islands connected by the Pacific ocean in the Palawan province of the Philippines, this season of Survivor sees eighteen diverse castaways from South Africa's rainbow nation fighting it out to become the Sole Survivor, including one wild-card entry - a fan who clinched a spot on the show beating other wannabe Survivor contenders at a gruelling public outdoor event

programme.title: Rick Stein's Mediterranean Escapes
programme.desc: The chef samples Mediterranean food and visits his favourite places in the region. In the first programme he catches a ferry to the mountainous island of Corsica, where he tastes sausages and sheep's cheese, and discovers the locals have a passion for chestnuts

programme.title: Special Ops: Crime Squad UK
programme.desc: Britain's most talented detectives uncover human trafficking in Bristol, hunt the leader of a county lines gang in Surrey, and trawl through hours of CCTV to stop a vaccine fraudster in London

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The three motoring enthusiasts head to Spain on a mission to help its struggling economy - but the convertible supercars they take are very expensive and anything but discreet. With Jeremy Clarkson in a McLaren MP4-12C, Richard Hammond driving a Ferrari 458 and James May behind the wheel of an Audi R8 V10, the trio encounter mountain passes, empty towns and an abandoned airport before creating their own street circuit in a deserted Madrid development. Plus, Sherlock star Benedict Cumberbatch sets a lap time in the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May embark on a project to build a car that can turn into a hovercraft and bring relief to flooded areas. Their efforts do not start smoothly, but it is not long before the trio are demonstrating the brilliance of their creation with an eventful journey down the River Avon. Plus, Jeremy grabs the keys to two variants of the Mercedes-Benz SLS AMG supercar - the V8-engined Black Series with a roaring 622bhp, and the 740bhp Electric Drive, which is powered by four electric motors. X-Men and Les Miserables star Hugh Jackman is the latest celebrity to take the new Reasonably Priced Car around the test track

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: 50 teams take on an intense course in the shadow of the Iowa state capital - how will they survive the incredibly steep start ramp, an unforgiving kicker, and a unique split course?

programme.title: Canals: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc: Liz McIvor tells the story of the people who operated the canal boats, carrying fuel and goods around the country. During the Victorian era they gained reputations for criminality, violence and drinking, but was such a reputation deserved? Liz discovers grisly canal crimes, investigates health and welfare on-board working boats, and looks at why canal children were last on the list to be offered safeguards and formal education. She reveals the campaigners who set out to tackle this injustice, including George Smith of Coalville, Leicestershire, and Sister Mary Ward of Stoke Bruerne, Northamptonshire

programme.title: Canals: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc: Liz McIvor explores the heritage of the canal network. After years of decline, the inland waterways were eventually restored to become places of leisure and tranquillity. Liz visits the Pontcysyllte Aqueduct in north Wales and travels to Birmingham where canals have become catalysts for property development and urban regeneration

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey from Ayr to Skye and investigates the parallel 'roads' etched in the side of Glen Roy - one of the geological mysteries of the 19th century. He also finds out how the Victorians put a weather observatory on the top of Ben Nevis, and crosses the Glenfinnan viaduct by steam train

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: In the final leg of his journey from Ayr to Skye, Michael Portillo discovers how the railways provided Second World War commandos with the means to travel to the isolated landscape of Lochailort, where they were able to train without attracting the attention of German spies. He also learns why langoustines have replaced herring as the best catch in the fishing port of Mallaig, and explores the history of Highland crofters

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on the first leg of a journey to Leeds, beginning at London's Euston station. He finds out what happened to the once proud Euston Arch and heads to Camden to see how goods were transported by rail, road and canal. He reflects on the Harrow rail disaster of 1952 and visits a country estate in Tring, Hertfordshire, before alighting at Cheddington in Buckinghamshire, which is close to the scene of 1963's Great Train Robbery

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey to Leeds by travelling through Buckinghamshire, meeting one of the Second World War's most secret agents at Bletchley. In Olney, he learns about a poet whose words are still sung today, and explores the first purpose-built railway town at Wolverton. His last stop is Newport Pagnell, where he tackles the ancient craft of vellum-making

programme.title: Bangers and Cash

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo learns more about the country's railways, beginning with the Great Eastern Line, which runs along the edge of England and into central London. On his travels, the former politician discovers the grave-robbing history of Great Yarmouth and tries his hand at working a Victorian swing bridge in Reedham, Norfolk. He also takes to the air to reveal how a rail guidebook helped aviators during the Second World War

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey along the Great Eastern Line, which ventures from the edge of England to the heart of London. In this leg, he examines the Victorians' fascination with the Suffolk village of Dunwich, Britain's answer to Atlantis, and discovers how nearby Felixstowe became home to the UK's biggest container port

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: The next part of Michael Portillo's journey from London to Leeds begins in Northampton, where Victorian methods have been used to make shoes for more than 130 years. The ex-politician then heads to Warwickshire, learning about the legacy of Dr Thomas Arnold at Rugby School and finding out how Coventry's craftsmen learned to adapt to survive, before ending this leg of his trip in Nuneaton

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: On the next stage of his journey to Leeds, Michael Portillo sets off in Leicester, where he finds out about the hunt for Richard III's remains.
