programme.desc: Derek is picking up two expertly crafted batmobile replicas in the home counties and Dave can't control his enthusiasm for a Ford US wartime jeep

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The capture and subsequent suicide of Heinrich Himmler. One of Hitler's most feared allies, his earlier reign of persecution had resulted in the deaths of millions of people

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: A program set up by the Special Operations Executive, the forerunner to MI6, to undermine German and Japanese officers by spraying them with a foul-smelling substance

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: On the final leg of his journey, Michael Portillo rediscovers a once-famous poet in Nottingham and travels on a railway line resurrected by popular demand after falling victim to Beeching's cuts. He finds out how Doncaster rail workers shaped British political history, before reaching his final destination of Leeds, where he auditions at Britain's oldest continuously working music hall

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on the first leg of a journey from Southampton to Wolverhampton, beginning by being taught how to set a table aboard the luxury liner Queen Elizabeth. In the village of Netley he finds the remains of an extensive military hospital built by order of Queen Victoria, and ends his travels in Basingstoke, where he learns out about a pitched battle between townspeople and the Salvation Army

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc: Robbie Cumming's exploration of the English canal network continues across the Pennines from Marple to Huddersfield, where his journey is hampered by a fallen tree and a leaking lock pound

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson examines the history of Robin Hood's Bay, the fishing village on the North Yorkshire coast, revealing tales of smuggling intrigue and bravery

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Armed with his 1913 railway guide, Michael Portillo travels through Italy from Turin to Venice.Along the way, he recreates a scene from the Michael Caine film The Italian Job on a Fiat test track and takes a trip in a seaplane to investigate the early 20th-century British love affair with Lake Como. In Verona, he visits the house used to attract Edwardian tourists to the alleged setting of Shakespeare's Romeo and Juliet and finds a microcosm of pre-First World War Europe at the Venice Biennale art exhibition

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's India
programme.desc: Joanna's adventures across India conclude as she explores Rajasthan, Delhi and the mountainous North West, before ending in Kashmir, the place of her birth. Her first stop takes her to the Ranthambhore National Park, where she learns about the Wildlife Protection Society of India's tiger conservation programmes. Joanna's next stop takes her to the city of Delhi, where she begins her exploration of the capital at Humayun's Tomb, before ending her 5000 mile journey in Srinagar in Kashmi, the place where she was born

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The competition comes from in and around Brighton. The first host, 47-year-old radio presenter Guy, plans a musical evening with a Mexican menu and an air guitar competition. His guests are 26-year-old recruitment company director Emma, 28-year-old pilot Tim, 38-year-old personal trainer Hannah and 50-year-old 'love doctor' Monti. Guy hosts a hilarious evening with lessons in love, surprising revelations and a dessert that doesn't go to plan

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is the second day in and around Brighton, and bubbly 26-year-old Emma is hosting a beach-themed dinner party in the hope of winning the £1,000 cash prize. After a day of forgotten ingredients and culinary calamities, Emma has some questions up her sleeve to help her find out more about 'love doctor' Monti. Dutch pilot Tim is also feeling the love, as a bromance begins to blossom

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The competition continues in and around Brighton, as Dutch pilot Tim draws on his travel experience to produce an international menu. After a turbulence-free day in the kitchen, Tim continues to charm his guests, especially DJ Guy

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Personal trainer Hannah reveals quite a lot more about herself to her guests. There are no shortage of shocks and surprises as layer after saucy layer is peeled away from the usually quiet and reserved host, but there's sauciness of a different kind when one guest annoys the others by defiantly adding their own condiments to each of the three courses

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The final night of competition in and around Brighton, sees 50-year-old 'love doctor' Monti try to cast his spell over his guests in an attempt to win the £1000 cash prize. programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Birmingham pair Derek Hansel and Gina Awoko are looking for a home in Almeria, Spain, that they can eventually retire to and also generate some rental income from. Jasmine Harman shows them a range of properties within their £300,000 budget, from a coastal renovation project to an inland cortijo. However, it remains to be seen whether she can deliver the perfect property in the perfect location

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Greg has been visiting Cyprus for nearly 40 years, and after introducing Tina to the island, she has fallen in love with it too. Helping the pair find the holiday home is property expert Leah Charles-King, who shows the pair the very best of what their £190,000 budget can buy in the western part of the island

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: In Italy, a messy guest throws a couple off-track as they get to grips with the demands of running holiday accommodation. Meanwhile, as work to their bar goes down to the wire, it remains to be seen whether a group of friends will be able to pull off their grand opening

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Kicking off a week in and around Cardiff is mental health support worker and budding singer Tracey, who throws a Caribbean carnival for her guests. Those she is hoping to impress are business owner Nathanael, steel worker Giulio, theatre designer and artist Ashley and prison teacher Alice

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Nathanael hosts the second night in Cardiff and treats his guests to a sports-themed evening, meanwhile Ashley treats the group by showing off his twerking skills. Alice reveals her most embarrassing moment and Giulio gives Tracey his best wooing face

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Alice hosts the third night in Cardiff and invites her guests down the rabbit hole to a Mad Hatter's tea party. With some unusual techniques for food preparation involving power tools and beer steam, will the team be impressed or will it be off with her head?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Theatre designer and artist Ashley hosts the fourth night in Cardiff, aiming to deliver a night of nostalgia from his childhood. Ashley's play for the prize reflects thought and effort with his creative menu touching on classics from the 1970s, but also celebrating perennial crowd-pleasers

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Last to host in Cardiff is steel worker Giulio, who after all the comments across the week has left himself open to criticism. He's treating his guests to an authentic Italian night and at the same time hoping to prove his heritage once and for all. Vegetarian Ashley is served the same nightmare food for both starter and main, Alice is left with a dental dilemma, while Nathanael challenges Giulio for further proof of his nationality

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton helps motorbike enthusiast Jennie look for a home on the western Costa del Sol. With a budget of £85,000, Laura lines up five impressive properties

programme.title: Sarah Beeny's New Life in the Country
programme.desc: Spring arrives and after months of lockdown, the boys are all heading back to school, meaning Graham can get stuck in to project managing the house build. He and Sarah are planning a large dining room for entertaining, with a centrepiece table that used to belong to rock star Ronnie Wood. Artist Graham also draws on his skills to apply some decorative touches to the room - but will it be theatrical enough for Sarah? Meanwhile, the couple also visit a pig farmer who shows them the cycle from piglet to pork chop

programme.title: Matt Baker: Our Farm in the Dales
programme.desc: Janice says an emotional goodbye to some of her beloved Hampshire Down sheep, and Matt's plan to build a patio and seating area in front of the farmhouse begins to take shape. Meanwhile, with the body of the Dodge fully stripped, Matt and the restoration garage team face the challenge of separating it from its chassis, and Nicola accompanies Mike on a shopping trip in search of ingredients for a celebratory paella

programme.title: A Lake District Farm Shop
programme.desc: Farm shop buyer Alex travels to Morecambe Bay for a visit to Furness Fish, who trawl for shrimps to create the local delicacy of potted brown shrimp, a tradition dating back to the 18th century. A soap-maker, who uses milk from her own cow, hopes to win new business with her latest dog shampoo products, while a muesli maker prepares a bid for a place at the hotel buffet table

programme.title: The Great Pottery Throw Down
programme.desc: The six remaining potters discover their wild sides, as they create metallic-effect endangered animal sculptures fired in oil drums, before judges Keith and Rich set a surprise second challenge to throw a tall, thin-necked vase. Who will beast their way to the quarter-final, and who will be heading home?

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Two paramedic crews rush to a man who is said to not be breathing, but there's a surprise in store when they arrive. Too much alcohol leaves a young woman collapsed unconscious in the street. A man is woken in the night with severe chest pains. A two-year-old has a seizure, and a 23-month-old has a large lump on their head as a result of a fall.

programme.title: SAS: Who Dares Wins
programme.desc: The remaining recruits' will to survive is severely tested with an extraction task used in the Vietnam War, and there's an intense beasting in a fight for the survival of the fittest. With the hardships of the jungle closing in, a lack of sleep, a calorie deficit from ration packs, and their bodies starting to fail, will any of the recruits make it through a survival task that requires navigating through the jungle pursued by hunters during a mission behind enemy lines?

programme.title: Guy Martin's Great British Power Trip
programme.desc: Guy Martin visits the most important place in the entire national grid - the central control room - where electricity is bought, sold and routed every single second of the day. Temporarily tasked with the challenging job of keeping the country's lights on, Guy spends thousands of pounds in just a few minutes balancing the electricity supply-and-demand market, before his attention turns to the rise of renewable energy. He works with the army, who are pioneering a new solar-powered workshop, before embarking on the gruelling training required to become an off-shore wind farm technician

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Bobby Davro throws the first of the week's dinner parties with a schooldays-themed event. programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Actress Lesley Joseph hosts the final dinner party of the week, and tries to impress her diners with a Titanic-themed evening, complete with a chamber orchestra. However, they are left bemused when she begins blow-drying her duck, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

Drama, starring Mark Harmon

programme.title: Motorway Patrol
programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. The series is centred around the roads of Auckland, the country's largest urban area, and features motoring chaos including major traffic collisions, escaped animals and pedestrians on busy roads. programme.desc: A bungling drug mule tries to avoid being caught, an elderly gambler's luck runs out when Immigration uncover his ongoing scam, and Biosecurity intercept a delivery from Russia

programme.title: Nothing to Declare
programme.desc: Fly-on-the-wall documentary accessing the world of national security at Australia's biggest airports as customs and immigration officers tackle drug runners, illegal immigrants and terrorists

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: A version of the Enterprise that was destroyed more than 20 years ago and long-dead former crew member Tasha Yar appear through a temporal rift, leading Picard into a race against time to change history and save billions of lives. Sci-fi drama, guest starring Denise Crosby

programme.title: Warehouse 13
programme.desc: Claudia, Pete and Myka try to help when Eureka resident Fargo and his colleague Jerry become trapped inside a video game that envelops all of the player's senses

programme.title: The Librarians
programme.desc: Cassandra takes a vacation in Havenport, the 'Safest Town in America.' Fantasy adventure, starring Lindy Booth and Rebecca Romijn

programme.title: Star Trek: Voyager
programme.desc: A Kazon child hoping to reach the rank of warrior attacks a shuttle piloted by Chakotay, who unwittingly condemns his would-be enemy to death by refusing to fight back. Sci-fi adventure, starring Robert Beltran

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Pride joins forces with an old Navy friend who has been given a lethal dose of polonium. Dr Gabriel Lin (guest star BD Wong) is all too aware that he has little time to live, but is determined to catch his killer. When the same radioactive substance is discovered on a water bottle that Gabriel's brother is about to drink, it appears that both siblings might be in the killer's sights. With Scott Bakula and Lucas Black

programme.title: Ross Kemp: Extreme World
programme.desc: Ross travels to Memphis, Tennessee, one of the most racially segregated cities in the US, to find out why such a divide still exists in today's society. He speaks to gang members, former convicts, community leaders and government officials in his search for answers

programme.title: Ross Kemp: Extreme World
programme.desc: Ross stays close to home for the final film, investigating how British seaside towns have been affected by the boom in cheap foreign holidays. Once celebrated, coastal resorts are now in the grip of once unimaginable levels of social decline. Many have become unemployment black spots, while former hotels and guest houses are being used to home the country's most vulnerable residents. Ross visits the worst affected areas to investigate the realities behind their tragic decline, and to find out what can be done to revive their fortunes

programme.title: Snapped
programme.desc: The murder of a fire lieutenant that led police to uncover details of a bitter neighbourhood feud and the work of a cunning mastermind

programme.title: How I Caught the Killer
programme.desc: An unlikely informant holds the key to justice when 59-year-old antiques dealer Michael Griffiths is targeted and brutally killed in his home

programme.title: Brit Cops
programme.desc: Sharing shifts with Cambridgeshire's police force, this documentary reveals what life on the beat is really like. Contains strong language and some distressing scenes

programme.title: Motorway Patrol
programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. The series is centred around the roads of Auckland, the country's largest urban area, and features motoring chaos including major traffic collisions, escaped animals and pedestrians on busy roads. There is also footage of drivers falling asleep at the wheel, overloaded vehicles and suspects caught with illegal substances - plus a host of excuses as the people pulled over try to persuade officers they have not done anything wrong

programme.desc: A terrifying force from outer space freezes members of the Moonbase Alpha team, leaving the crew facing a race against time to save lives. Sci-fi adventure, starring Martin Landau and Barbara Bain

programme.title: Plane Crash Recreated
programme.desc: The story of US Airways Flights 1549, which lost engine power after a collision with a flock of birds, leaving Captain Sully Sullenberger to land the plane on the Hudson River

programme.title: Terry and Mason's Great Food Trip
programme.desc: Mason McQueen's black cab takes Terry Wogan to Conwy, on the north coast of Wales, a small medieval town with a large castle. The locals show off their cuisine, and after getting a barbecue going, Terry tempts motorists to sample his home made burgers. The taxi also heads over the Menai Strait to Anglesey, and the duo learn how to produce salt, the ancient skill of oyster farming and the importance of conservation

programme.desc: London cabbie Mark Monroe takes you to the hidden and more quirky parts of the amazing city that normally lie undiscovered

programme.title: Zoo Robbery ()
programme.desc: With Paul Gyngell. When the world's only yeti in captivity is kidnapped from London Zoo, a group of children succeed in rescuing it

programme.title: Above Us the Waves (1955)
programme.desc: A Royal Navy commander sets out to win his admiral's confidence by launching secret midget submarine raids on the formidable German battleship Tirpitz, which is hiding in the fjords of Norway. However, as time unfolds, the mission becomes increasingly perilous. Second World War drama based on a true story, starring John Mills, Donald Sinden, John Gregson and James Robertson Justice

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours narrated by Dewyne Lindsay, this time exploring Camden and Sydenham for locals and tourists.

programme.title: Blackonomics

programme.title: David Attenborough's Light on Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough embarks on a search for the lights of nature, on a journey that will lead to ocean depths, claustrophobic caves and forests by night

programme.title: London Live News
programme.desc: News weather events and the best of the capital's culture. Join us to explore life in London

programme.title: The Baron
programme.desc: Cordelia travels to South America on Mannering's behalf to meet an explorer who has something to tell them

programme.title: Cat Hospital
programme.desc: A look inside Ireland's first purpose-built clinic that caters exclusively for cats, nestled in the leafy environs of Glanmire outside Cork city. In this first episode, veterinary surgeon Clare Meade and her team meet the families of the cats they treat to try to understand their ailments. Biker Wolfgang worries that Paulina, the newest arrival to his feline family of 25, is having extreme difficulty breathing, Clare diagnoses a large growth in Paulina's throat and it looks like she will need to operate

programme.title: Danger Dogs
programme.desc: Documentary following dogs and their trainers as they are put through their paces in everything from sniffing out drugs to finding roadside bombs in conflict zones

programme.title: The Comic Strip Presents

programme.title: Quest Boxing League
programme.desc: Welcome to the UK's toughest boxing competition, where aspiring young boxers battle it out inside the ring for their chance to be crowned the Quest Boxing League Champion

programme.title: Terry and Mason's Great Food Trip
programme.desc: Broadcaster Terry Wogan and London cabbie Mason McQueen continue their culinary quest, heading for Wells in Somerset, which is one of Britain's smallest cities. They also try Mendip wallfish cooked in fresh herbs and cider-flavoured chorizo, before rounding off their sojourn with a banquet fit for the abbot himself

programme.title: Secrets of London with Mark Monroe
programme.desc: London cabbie Mark Monroe takes you to the hidden and more quirky parts of this amazing city that normally lie undiscovered

programme.title: World Natural Heritage: Colombia
programme.desc: The UNESCO National Park Malpelo, located in the Eastern Pacific, 500k off the Colombian coast

programme.title: Paris Blues (1961)
programme.desc: Two talented blues musicians attempt to make their mark on the Parisian music scene - but complications get in the way as they encounter a bevy of beautiful fans. Romantic drama, starring Paul Newman, Joanne Woodward, Sidney Poitier and Louis Armstrong

programme.title: Crooks in Cloisters (1964)
programme.desc: Six train robbers hide from the law in a deserted monastery off the Cornish coast, where disguising themselves as monks proves the perfect way of lying low while carrying on with various criminal activities. But the crooks have a hard task keeping up the pretence when two real monks visit the island - especially since one of the gang is a woman. Comedy, with Ronald Fraser, Barbara Windsor, Bernard Cribbins, Wilfrid Brambell and Davy Kaye

programme.title: The Baron
programme.desc: Cordelia travels to South America on Mannering's behalf to meet an explorer who has something to tell them

programme.title: London Live News
programme.desc: News weather events and the best of the capital's culture. Join us to explore life in London

programme.title: Revolution in Colour
programme.desc: Part one of a two part documentary exploring the struggle for Irish independence in the early 20th century. Professor Eunan O'Halpin examines the years leading up to the 1918 British general election, which saw a rise in radicalisation among both Nationalists and Unionists

programme.title: The Prisoner
programme.desc: Number Six faces a threat to his sanity in the midst of a masked ball, where he meets Peter Pan and Little Bo Peep and finds himself being placed on trial for making an audacious bid to foil his captors. Cult drama, starring Patrick McGoohan

programme.title: The Great Train Robbery
programme.desc: First of a two-part drama by Broadchurch writer Chris Chibnall telling the story of the most infamous heist in British history, beginning with the planning and execution of the crime from the perspective of the perpetrators themselves. After a robbery at Heathrow Airport in 1962, Bruce Reynolds sets his sights on another target - the plan being to rob the overnight mail train from Glasgow to Euston. A team is assembled, schemes are laid out and rehearsals begin. But despite their meticulous planning, the operation is compromised by an attack on the train driver and a botched getaway. Before long, the gang have become the most wanted men in Britain. Luke Evans, Paul Anderson, Martin Compston, Jack Roth and Neil Maskell star

programme.title: Awaydays (2009)
programme.desc: A bored and disaffected young man seeks an outlet for his pent-up aggression. He befriends a member of a local football hooligan group and falls in with the crowd, finding release in drink, drugs, football and fighting. Drama set in the 1980s, based on Kevin Sampson's novel, starring Nicky Bell, Stephen Graham, Liam Boyle and Oliver Lee

programme.title: Bloody Mama (1970)
programme.desc: A poverty-stricken psychotic woman goes on a rampage against society along with her homicidal children, robbing banks, kidnapping the wealthy and resorting to murder at the drop of a hat. Thriller based on the story of the infamous Ma Barker, starring Shelley Winters, Robert De Niro, Robert Walden, Don Stroud, Clint Kimbrough. Pat Hingle and Bruce Dern

programme.title: Honour (2014)
programme.desc: A Muslim girl is forbidden from seeing her boyfriend by her traditional parents, but she defies them and the couple run away together. The girl's mother feels the family has been dishonoured, and hires a mysterious bounty hunter to track her down and carry out punishment for her disobedience. Thriller, starring Paddy Considine and Aiysha Hart

programme.title: Royal Children: Prince William and Prince Harry
programme.desc: Documentary profiling Princes William and Harry

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing lesser known areas of London for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: Terry and Mason's Great Food Trip
programme.desc: Broadcaster Terry Wogan and London cabbie Mason McQueen continue their culinary quest, heading for Wells in Somerset, which is one of Britain's smallest cities. The pair visit the famous cathedral close as they begin their search for the region's most sought-after delicacies, and take in the medieval marketplace to sample cheddar cheese and sparkling cider. They also try Mendip wallfish cooked in fresh herbs and cider-flavoured chorizo, before rounding off their sojourn with a banquet fit for the abbot himself

programme.title: Roswell Conspiracies
programme.desc: The story of allied intelligence agents who've discovered aliens on Earth who are bent on taking over the world. In response, the agents form a top-secret multinational agency, The Global Alliance

programme.title: Dork Hunters from Outer Space
programme.desc: Alien Dorks disguise themselves as humans to use Earth as a base to take over the universe, but they face opposition from some unlikely teenage heroes

programme.title: Pocket Dragon Adventures
programme.desc: A group of very small dragons live with a kindly old wizard, they're not big enough to fly but that doesn't stop them having many adventures

programme.title: Extreme Dinosaurs
programme.desc: 65 Million years ago, Dinosaurs disappeared. Now they're Back! T-Bone, Spike, Bullzeye, and Stegz. Four prehistoric dinosaurs, evolved into intelligent beings reawaken in a bizarre new world

programme.title: Stone Age
programme.desc: Meet a group of typical suburban nine-year-old kids with friends, foes and families kicking it really old school, in prehistoric times

programme.title: Stone Age
programme.desc: Meet a group of typical suburban nine-year-old kids with friends, foes and families kicking it really old school, in prehistoric times

programme.title: Legend of the Dragon
programme.desc: The guardian of the temple has passed on and a new Golden Dragon must be Chosen from a brother and sister - Twins born in the Year of the Dragon. Only one will be chosen. Their sibling bond tested

programme.title: Space 1999
programme.desc: Koenig and the Moonbase Alpha crew find themselves at war with an unnamed planet - and the hostilities have a disastrous outcome. Martin Landau stars

programme.title: The Baron
programme.desc: Cordelia travels to South America on Mannering's behalf to meet an explorer who has something to tell them

programme.title: Revolution in Colour
programme.desc: Part one of a two part documentary exploring the struggle for Irish independence in the early 20th century. Professor Eunan O'Halpin examines the years leading up to the 1918 British general election, which saw a rise in radicalisation among both Nationalists and Unionists

programme.title: Coastal Railways with Julie Walters
programme.desc: The actress travels from Newcastle to Edinburgh by high speed train. Along the way, she stops off at the coastal town of Alnmouth, discovers where the phrase Keep Calm and Carry On originated, visits the world's biggest gannet colony, and goes out to sea with a lobster breeder. When she reaches her destination, she discovers the connection between the railway and the famous Balmoral Hotel

programme.title: Gypsy Girl (1965)
programme.desc: With Hayley Mills. A young, lonely, emotionally challenged teenage girl finds solace in burying dead animals after the sudden traumatic death of a childhood friend ten years earlier

programme.title: Up in the World (1956)
programme.desc: A bumbling window cleaner is elated to land a job at an aristocrat's country house. However, the spoilt young heir to the estate likes to play pranks on him - and lands the hapless servant in very hot water after the pair make a trip to a nightclub together and walk straight into a kidnap plot. Comedy, starring Norman Wisdom, Michael Caridia, Maureen Swanson and Jerry Desmonde

programme.title: Cat Hospital
programme.desc: A look inside Ireland's first purpose-built clinic that caters exclusively for cats, nestled in the leafy environs of Glanmire outside Cork city. In this first episode, veterinary surgeon Clare Meade and her team meet the families of the cats they treat to try to understand their ailments. Biker Wolfgang worries that Paulina, the newest arrival to his feline family of 25, is having extreme difficulty breathing, Clare diagnoses a large growth in Paulina's throat and it looks like she will need to operate

programme.title: Danger Dogs
programme.desc: Documentary following dogs and their trainers as they are put through their paces in everything from sniffing out drugs to finding roadside bombs in conflict zones

programme.title: London Live News
programme.desc: News weather events and the best of the capital's culture. Join us to explore life in London

programme.title: Shine On Harvey Moon
programme.desc: Rita is depressed after only just escaping the clutches of murderer Neville Heath

programme.title: Plane Crash Recreated
programme.desc: Survivors recall a routine flight from London Heathrow to Belfast International Airport that ended in tragedy when British Midland Flight 92 crashed onto a motorway embankment near the town of Kegworth on 8th January 1989

programme.title: The Hidden City
programme.desc: Lucy gets some unexpected news, as Vince tries to find her

programme.title: A Shock to the System (1990)
programme.desc: A frustrated executive accidentally pushes a homeless man into the path of a subway train. Realising he has got away with one killing, he begins to wonder how many more murders he can pull off - starting with his rivals at work, his nagging wife and anyone else who has ever caused him misery. Black comedy, starring Michael Caine, Elizabeth McGovern, Peter Riegert and Swoosie Kurtz

programme.title: Haraam (2018)
programme.desc: A man tries to pluck up the courage to profess his love to a departing co-worker of a very different cultural, ethnic and religious background before she leaves on her last day of work. Drama, starring Ainy Jaffri and Cherno Jagne

programme.title: Small City (2021)
programme.desc: A young street hustler from London and a drugs mule from Europe form an unlikely bond after a violent confrontation with a neighbourhood heavy. Thriller, starring Eddie Thompson

programme.title: Quest Boxing League
programme.desc: Welcome to the UK's toughest boxing competition, where aspiring young boxers battle it out inside the ring for their chance to be crowned the Quest Boxing League Champion

programme.title: News Rewind
programme.desc: A digest of news and events from across London from the past few days

programme.title: Talking Points
programme.desc: 'Current affairs affecting Londoners today and a look at the latest shows and films in the capital
